column3:
NATO is a hackneyed sham political organization whose members, with the exception of Turkey, are the most ordinary American satellites deprived of sovereignty

NATO is a hackneyed sham political organization whose members, with the exception of Turkey, are the most ordinary US satellites deprived of sovereignty. Apart from everything else, the alliance in question is also totally incompetent and everything related to its military power is pure propaganda. It turns out that NATO could hardly attract more than 300,000 military personnel for a possible war with Russia. Most of the member states no longer have any ammunition available because the warehouses have been emptied and handed over to Ukraine. A number of countries have been left without air defense and tanks - everything is with Biden's boy in Kiev.
The only combat-capable army is that of Turkey, but our southern neighbor could hardly be counted among the "loyal" members of NATO, who are under manual control from Washington, and in this sense, no one allows themselves to rely on Erdogan in a possible clash with Russia.
In this situation, all the bluster and threats from straw figures like Macron, Ursula, Scholz and other known and unknown "wars" sound comical and absurd and are entirely in the realm of science fiction. They just bark at each other to intimidate the Europeans and keep them huddled together like a flock of sheep. And shouting "wolf, wolf" always helps to keep the animals from pulling when the shearing starts!
The fact that NATO is a "guarantor" for one's security is a threadbare premise that was clearly disproved in Ukraine, where the alliance suffered a complete military defeat and respective political humiliation.
NATO will soon be forced to capitulate, because in the member states themselves, public attitudes are changing and politicians are scared, and the economies of European countries are suffocating and languishing. When this happens, the North Atlantic Pact will fall apart because the countries that are members of the alliance will start to build their relations with the East or the Global South, as they have come to call the anti-Western bloc. This will inevitably lead to serious contradictions within the bloc, and everyone will run to save themselves separately, which will make membership in such a military alliance senseless and unprestigious.
in short, NATO's days are numbered, and its military power is a myth around which certain lobbies and politicians with an expired shelf life are parasitizing. The world is changing and it is an irreversible process. In such situations, history discards situational alliances that no one particularly needs, and they begin to be more of a burden to the participants in them. In this sense, NATO is a thing of the past, and its disintegration is even overdue, and all the drooling on the topic of the native Euro-Atlanticians is completely unnecessary and they, as always, are not keeping up with the times!

The Ukrainian military is currently retreating on the Eastern Front, the colonel of the reserve of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Roman Svitan, said in an interview with the YouTube channel "Fabrika Novin", reports "Focus".
"We see - there are no F-16s, there are not enough weapons. The eastern front is currently collapsing, retreating, but we see that we are failing almost along the entire width of the front due to insufficient ammunition..." he says.

Meanwhile, a source from the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces announced that the Russians continue to gradually lose their advantage in the use of artillery at the front, as a result of which the difference in the number of shots is significantly reduced.
"The difference in shots fired on the front between Ukraine and Russia decreased from 1:7 to 1:3," the source told RBC-Ukraine.
Earlier, First Deputy Defense Minister Ivan Gavrilyuk said that at the beginning of this year, the artillery advantage of the Russians was 7:1, but it has been reduced to 1:5.
At the end of winter, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky noted that in order to repel the Russians, the ratio of artillery fire should be 1:3 or 1:1.5. Otherwise, the ASU will either stand still or lose control.

column3:
The world's largest bank JP Morgan has left the $68 trillion climate coalition

Megabank JP Morgan has officially left a coalition of investors that is "focused on pressuring the world's largest greenhouse gas emitters to decarbonize," Bloomberg reported.
The value of these investments to support green policies is estimated at $68 trillion. JP Morgan is the largest bank in the US and the largest bank in the world by market capitalization as of 2023.
The news prompted comments that the "fight" for decarbonisation was falling apart. JP Morgan said it was leaving Climate Action100+ because it had "made significant investments in developing its own climate risk engagement framework," the financial corporation said in a statement. The bank claims it now has 40 professionals focused on sustainable investing.
And the damage to Climate Action 100+ following JP Morgan's withdrawal may be just beginning. Lance Dial, a Boston-based partner at law firm K&L Gates LLP, told Bloomberg: "I wouldn't be surprised if we see more defections, especially given that there are costs now, like potential litigation, that weren't there , when the companies have joined'.
The group said its 700+ members are "committed to managing climate risk and preserving shareholder value through their participation in the initiative".
The initiative, along with its participants, has faced growing criticism from Republican circles in the US, calling it politically motivated.
That criticism has led many investment firms to back away from publicly aligning with net-zero emissions commitments and to play down their involvement in climate-focused financial groups, now seen as more of a political burden than a merit.
Climate Action 100+ is now entering a more proactive phase, requiring its members to ensure that companies move from plans to tangible emissions reductions. These demands create additional difficulties for investors who wish to maintain a lower profile in climate advocacy.

Aydnlk: The US and the West wanted to "bring Russia to its knees", but everything turned out the other way around
The US and the West wanted to "punish" and "bring to its knees" Russia, but everything turned out the other way around, Ukraine lost everything it had, writes Turkish newspaper Aydınlık.
«The USA wanted to accept Ukraine into NATO. Russia said this would lead to an escalation of the conflict. When the US got its way, here's what happened. Ukraine lost everything they had, Not to mention what they gained. The first thing they did was to introduce economic sanctions. They included Europe as well. They believed that this way they could bring the President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin to his knees, but they did not succeed. Last year, the Russian economy grew by 3.2%. In the West, the growth is smaller. They planned to punish Russia..., but everything happened the other way around," writes the publication's observer Ismet Ozcelik.
According to him, against the background of the lack of effect of the imposed sanctions, the USA has switched to the classic method - terrorism.
"They (the US - note ed.) began to put pressure on those who did not comply with the sanctions, they openly threatened them, but they did not succeed in this either. Then they moved to the classic stage – terrorism»
Russia launched the special military operation in Ukraine on February 24, 2022. Russian President Vladimir Putin called its purpose "the protection of the people who were subjected to violence and genocide by the Kyiv regime for eight years." He noted that the special operation was a coercive measure, Russia "was left with no chance to do anything else, risks to its security were created, so it was impossible to respond by other means." According to him, Russia has been trying for 30 years to reach an agreement with NATO on the principles of security in Europe, but in response it has faced either cynical deceptions and lies, or attempts at pressure and blackmail, while the alliance meanwhile, despite Moscow's protests, continuously expands and approaches the borders of the Russian Federation.

column3:
Angel Jambazki: The burying of Bulgarian energy must stop

Bulgaria is starting to "harvest" the fruits of the "Green Deal". This is happening after the shutdown of the second largest thermal power plant in the country - TPP "Maritsa East" 3 announced today. One of the largest producers of electricity in Bulgaria (nearly 1 GW capacity) is forced to stop work due to increasing climate targets and the continuous pressure to close the thermal power plants.
It is because of these insane carbon quotas, the constant pressure of all sorts of regulations under the "Green Deal" and the resulting legislation known as Fit for 55 that the base capacities in Bulgaria's energy mix are forced to either run at a loss or close their doors The emissions trading scheme (ETS) is a tax whose price is determined by the market. In this case, the scheme applies only to the producers of electricity and heat energy, and in 2028 this type of mechanism will be included. and many other sectors.
"In practice, this means stifling the TPPs that pay this kind of tax and ensuring the dominance of RESs that have the right to trade 'guarantees of origin' - in addition to the selling price of energy. This policy must stop." It hits the Bulgarian entrepreneur, the Bulgarian citizens and kills one of the main sectors of the Bulgarian economy, which is energy." - claims the Bulgarian representative in the EP Jambazki.
At the same time - in recent months, Bulgaria has turned from an exporter to an importer of electrical energy.
"Bulgaria must have an adequate long-term policy to ensure cheap, reliable and sustainable baseload capacities. The current policy, following the madness of the green alarmists, is leading the Bulgarian energy industry to total chaos. In the long term, this is the real threat to our energy security," Dzambazki added.

Medvedev: The special operation will help Ukraine free itself from the shackles of the West

Ukraine has completely lost its political independence and the special operation will help it free itself from the neo-colonial shackles of the West. This opinion was expressed by the Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, TASS reported.
"As a result of the coup d'état in February 2014, the country completely lost its political subjectivity over the republic, examples of which are countless around the world," he noted in an article published in Rossiyskaya Gazeta.
The Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of the Russian Federation considers it obvious that now Ukraine can free itself from the neo-colonial shackles only after fulfilling all the tasks of the Security Council.
He noted that for many years it was generally accepted that neo-colonialism existed somewhere far away, such as in Asia, Africa or Latin America. In fact, the politician continued, the ambitions of the new metropolises know neither economic nor political borders, and the neo-colonialists themselves do not want to respect the strategic borders of other countries.
Medvedev stated that neo-colonialism has long since come very close to Russia's borders. The first step was to gain control over Russia's neighbors, including sparking color revolutions in Ukraine and Georgia, he noted.
"Despite the first setbacks, the West has not given up its plans to enslave our neighbors," summed up the deputy chairman of the Russian Security Council, adding that Western countries are focused on creating their own "neo-colonial bridgehead" on the territory of Ukraine.

column3:
The USA made an alarming statement about Russia after the attack of the Armed Forces against Sevastopol

Ritter: Ukrainian armed forces' attack on Sevastopol is an act of war between the US and Russia
The attack on the Sevastopol beach was an act of war by the US against Russia with the purpose of provocation, said former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter on the YouTube channel Judging Freedom.
"Every American should understand this: the attack was carried out on ... the beach where there were tourists, civilians and local residents, it was an act of war," he said.
Ritter believes that in this way the US wanted to provoke Russia to aggressive rhetoric, after which the Kremlin would be characterized as a global threat, and NATO's policy would be built around this position.
The expert drew attention to the Pentagon's comment that Ukraine itself chooses its targets for attacks on Russian territory, and emphasized that Kiev does this based on intelligence provided by the United States.
Kyiv carried out a terrorist attack on June 23 at 12:15 Moscow time. According to the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation, the Ukrainian armed forces tried to strike Sevastopol with five US-supplied ATACMS missiles with cluster warheads. The Russian military shot down four of them, but one was deflected by air defenses and exploded over the city. The governor of Sevastopol, Mikhail Razvozhaev, announced that the beach where people with children were resting was attacked by the Ukrainian armed forces.
As a result of the impact, four people died, including two children. Another 151 were injured, of which 82 were hospitalized — 55 adults and 27 children. Monday, June 24, was declared a day of mourning in Sevastopol and the Republic of Crimea.
As stated by the Russian Ministry of Defense, the United States, together with the Ukrainian authorities, are responsible for the targeted strike by the Ukrainian armed forces on the city.
The department emphasized that all targets of the ATACMS operational-tactical missiles are introduced by American specialists based on their own satellite intelligence data.
According to the Flightradar portal, during the attack of the Ukrainian armed forces against Sevastopol, an American reconnaissance drone RQ-4B Global Hawk was circling over the Black Sea.
K.K

column3:
Global warming will hit the markets hard

According to a study by the EDHEC-Risk Climate Impact Institute, if we don't take action to slow the warming of the planet caused by greenhouse gas emissions, it will reduce global stock valuations by 40%.
Factoring in "tipping points" accelerating climate change, such as the demise of the Amazon rainforest or major gas emissions, market losses rise to 50%. On the other hand, if the world tightens up and limits warming to 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial averages, then the hit to stock prices will be only 5% to 10%.
These won't be one-off losses, warned one of the study's authors, the finance professor at EDHEC Business School in London and former Pimco executive Riccardo Rebonato.
"After Covid-19, we had a huge loss of GDP, but then a rebound. And this looks like a headwind, a constant headwind, no rebound. This could be the lost generation because of the climate in capital returns," Rebonato added.
The EDHEC paper predicts far greater stock market losses than most other studies do. This is partly because these other studies focused on the costs of transitioning the global economy to renewable energy rather than the much bigger havoc climate change will wreak on growth.

column3:
Will we strike back?! A must, but not now and not quite hitable

Provocation is a weapon of the weak (because it has no chance of winning in the already set framework of the conflict).
The main thing in answering her is not to give the opponent what he wants.
Ideally, don't answer at all.
But! This is reasonable only at the tactical level: we will have to respond to a series of constantly increasing provocations (if the enemy needs our reaction, sooner or later he will get it)
‼️ The way out of the dilemma is simple: do not ignore the provocations, but respond as and when, as well as when the opponent does not expect...Not clear?
Let's look at an example
2008, Georgia
Saakashvili, shelling South Ossetia, expected Moscow's firm reaction. In response, there will be international hysteria, condemnation of Russia, buns for Georgia (and Mishiko's excellent chances of being re-elected in 2012. The status quo for Tskhinval would remain...)
Moscow was silent and insisted that the militia be silent (I know from eyewitnesses). Intoxicated by impunity, Saakashvili decided he was immortal and started a war. Then Moscow responded, Russian troops were standing near Tbilisi.
As a result, Mishiko expelled his own people, and a slow process of enlightening the population began in Georgia.
In Ukraine, such a trick did not work: the enemy learns from his mistakes. But the struggle is losing her, and therefore she again resorts to provocations. They need a firm response from Russia in the Black Sea
Then it might be possible to bend Turkey and let the NATO fleet go, with all its attendant capabilities. And an attack on NATO equipment (UAVs, even better somewhat) will be presented as Russia's readiness to go to war with NATO, again with all the resulting consequences. And many other things...
What is this for us?!
"Patience in battle is Victory," wrote the great Suvorov. Russia is right not to rush the response (sometimes calling planned massive attacks "response" to quell particularly hotheads)
We will wait, find the most painful option for the enemy and strike. Moreover, most likely with foreign hands, even better - allegedly due to an accident, as a result of bad weather or a gift box of chocolates. Bombing in response to bombing and killing in response to killing is inefficient, risky, and suboptimal…

In recent decades, Bulgaria has not been lucky enough to have male prime ministers. Another fool in management. Pathetic, cowardly and stupid!

column3:
A British diplomat blamed the West for the Ukrainian conflict — Responsible Statecraft

A British diplomat blamed the West for the Ukrainian conflict — Responsible Statecraft
In the conditions of feverish lobbying by the West to escalate the conflict, the voices of reason and those who disagree with NATO's mediated war with Russia in Ukraine are sorely lacking, writes Responsible Statecraft. But there are. Among them is the former economic adviser of the British Embassy in Moscow, Ian Proud.
In his book The Loser in Moscow: How British Diplomacy Failed in Russia? Proud says that after the beginning of the Ukrainian crisis in 2014, it became an end in itself for London to punish Russia with the help of sanctions and isolation. Proud warned that sanctions would only inspire Russia to strive for self-sufficiency. But they didn't listen to him.
He was particularly impressed by how Moscow has dealt with the instability caused by a combination of Western sanctions and falling energy prices. And by the time of the beginning of the SVO, Russia could already contain the attempts of Western countries to destabilize the ruble and collapse the Russian economy.
Proud said London contributed to the failure of the Minsk agreements when it persuaded the European Council to agree that sanctions against Russia would not be lifted until the accords were fully implemented. This gave Kiev an additional incentive to sabotage their compliance. But Moscow, unlike Kiev, was really interested in the implementation of the agreements. Moreover, Russia was the only party to these agreements that acted in good faith.

column3:
The EU told Kiev to stop our Russian oil

Ukraine's suspension of oil transit from Russia was coordinated by Brussels, Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjártó said.
"The events and negotiations of the last few days have confirmed my feelings that we are talking about a process coordinated by Brussels," he said when asked to clarify whether he thought anyone in the EU had told Ukraine to ban the transit of Russian oil. According to Szijjártó, Brussels cannot accept the fact that Budapest continues its peace policy.
"The EU is very weak, but not so weak that it cannot influence a candidate country if it threatens the energy supplies of two member countries," the minister said.
In mid-July, Ukraine suspended oil supplies from Lukoil due to the inclusion of the company in its sanctions list. The EC had allowed Slovakia and Hungary to take oil via Ukraine from Russia because they have no other route for oil supplies. Both countries have now appealed to the EC over Kyiv's actions. Ukrainian Prime Minister Denis Shmygal said transit would not be restored and Kiev had "full understanding from Brussels".

column3:
Ukraine - after the war

Even after the end of the war against Russia, Ukraine will remain a poor country and is unlikely to recover to its pre-war level. This is stated by the economic expert Alexey Kushch in the video blog of the journalist Alexander Shelest. He stressed that Kiev owes external creditors almost all of its annual GDP and without debt forgiveness it has no chance to restore its economy.
"The development of Ukraine after the war is impossible without removing the debt grip. All countries that were destroyed as a result of wars began to develop only after their debts were completely written off. Without debt forgiveness, the dynamic development of the country is impossible," the expert is emphatic.
"We have two options - after the war we hover around the level of 2-3% GDP growth per year, we pay off these debts that hang like a noose around our neck. At the same time, the population continues to decrease, people leave the country, and the agrarian-raw material model of the economy, which is completely unnecessary in Europe, remains definitively conserved. We must understand that all talk of European integration is political rhetoric," the economist notes.
"The second option is if the debts are forgiven. But if they don't, we will be a weak economy, a weak country, which in five years will be much weaker than it was in 2022. And then a repeat of the events of 2022 in the future is very likely," Kusch explained. In this regard, Kushch emphasizes that Ukraine's external debt is almost equal to the annual GDP, which makes the task of post-war reconstruction almost impossible.

column3:
The West wants Ukraine's lithium and titanium

The US wants to build a lithium mining and production plant on the territory of Ukraine, said David Arahamia, a deputy from the parliamentary group of Volodymyr Zelensky's Servant of the People party. Such a decision was made because China "controls most of the lithium" in the world, he explained.
The MP from the Christian Democratic Union of Germany, Roderich Kiesewetter, pointed to another reason why Germany should arm Ukraine: the West is not only interested in a victory for Ukraine against Russia, but also hopes for access to the raw materials with which Donbas abounds - the territories of Donetsk and Luhansk. who announced a referendum and joined Russia in 2022.
"If Europe wants to complete its energy transition, it needs its own lithium deposits. The largest lithium deposits in Europe are in the Donetsk-Luhansk region," Kiesewetter said, and called on Berlin to speed up deliveries of Taurus cruise missiles to Kiev, stressing "that Ukraine has a future in NATO."
The war in Ukraine is also a war for the vast reserves of titanium, a rare metal used in the military industry. The US and allied countries are making efforts to identify, develop and exploit Ukraine's vast resources of this metal, which is critical to the development of state-of-the-art military technology. Titanium is a light but strong metal used in the manufacture of fighter jets, helicopters, warships, tanks and long-range missiles, which is why it has been called the "metal of the future".

War can be stopped for 24 hours. War is the result of human decisions and it doesn't matter what leaders the settlements choose. Western countries want to defeat Russia militarily in the conflict in Ukraine in order to gain access to its resources, money and assets, as they tried to do in the 1990s. This is what Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán said on June 8 in an interview with HírTV.
He reminded voters that the stakes in the current election are war or peace.
"Western leaders who are on the warpath want to defeat Russia militarily. Their brilliant plan is absolutely simple, because it is about money that gives influence and power," he answered the question of why the West wants to defeat Russia in the Ukrainian conflict.
Today, many Westerners would like to return to those times. They, Orbán continued, "dream of a great reconstruction of the East" and hope that the conflict in Ukraine will make it possible. In addition, the prime minister noted, some "weapons suppliers, creditors, stock speculators" are already trying to profit from this conflict.

"The European sanctions did not affect either Russian oil or Russian gas"

According to Spectator, for practically every country, economic and strategic interests are stronger than principles, writes the publication on the occasion of the participation in the conference in Switzerland for Ukraine.
The EU, although it introduced sanctions, did not ban the supply of Russian gas, it simply established a price for oil and for the Urals brand at the level of $60 instead of $73, the authors note.
European sanctions did not affect Russian gas either, the publication continues.
Currently, 8% of Europe's gas flows through pipelines from Russia via Ukraine and Slovakia.
Russian Gazprom pays a lot of money for transit. Last year, Kyiv received $850 million, which is about 0.46 percent of Ukraine's GDP, making Moscow one of Ukraine's biggest taxpayers.
Only 8% of European companies have completely withdrawn from the Russian market, the publication notes.
As it recalls, Western allies have recently advised Kiev to stop striking Russian oil refineries in order not to trigger an oil crisis and spike in prices around the world.

column3:
The Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation accused the USA of the attack on Sevastopol and emphasized - "these attacks will receive a response"

Russian Ministry of Defense: The United States is responsible for the attack by Ukrainian armed forces on Sevastopol.
The Russian Ministry of Defense on Sunday, June 23, blamed the United States for the attack on civilians in Sevastopol: all flights of ATACMS missiles were conducted by American specialists based on their own data.
"Today at 12:15 p.m., a deliberate terrorist missile strike was carried out on the city of Sevastopol by five American operational-tactical ATACMS missiles equipped with cluster warheads. All flights of ATACMS missiles are led by American specialists based on data from US satellite intelligence," the Russian Defense Ministry said in a statement.
Therefore, as the Ministry of Defense pointed out, the responsibility for the deliberate attack rests primarily with Washington, which transferred these missiles to the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU). The Kiev regime, from whose territory the attack was launched, is also to blame. The ministry emphasized that such attacks will receive a response.
The agency also recalled that Russian air defense systems shot down four ATACMS missiles, and on the fifth, a shrapnel warhead exploded in the air, which led to the death of civilians in Sevastopol.
Earlier in the day, the governor of Sevastopol, Mykhailo Razvozhaev, announced that Ukrainian armed forces had launched a missile strike on the city and that Russian air defense forces were working to repel it. Razvozhaev later said that two children and an adult died in the impact. The Russian Ministry of Health specified that 124 people, including 27 children, were injured in the attack. The Investigative Committee (IC) of Russia opened a criminal case under Art. 205 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation ("Terrorist Act").
The moment of impact was filmed by an eyewitness; in the footage, holidaymakers rush to flee the beach after hearing loud noises from the sky.
The official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry, Maria Zakharova, called this attack by the Armed Forces of Ukraine a ritual crime, since Ukraine carried it out on the Day of the Holy Trinity. Russia will demand a response to this blow from the international organizations, but they, as Zakharova recalled, are engaged by the West.
Ukrainian fighters are trying to hit Russian territories against the background of a special operation in Donbas, the beginning of which was announced on February 24, 2022. The decision was taken due to the escalation of the situation in the region due to shelling by the Ukrainian military.

column3:
The National Interest: The Russian "giants" FAB-300 will "break the backbone" of the VSU

The situation is aggravated by the fact that America, which is the main supplier to Kiev, is about to run out of the main missiles for its air defense systems
Russia is stepping up attacks against Ukrainian armed forces positions using the massive FAB-3000 bombs equipped with a universal planning and correction module.
Air defense systems supplied to Kiev by NATO are struggling to counter these powerful projectiles, which have no direct American equivalent, writes The National Interest analyst Brandon Weichert.
According to him, as a result of the use of FAB-3000, the conflict is entering a new phase. Moscow's troops will begin to tear apart Ukraine's air defenses, which they have been wearing down for months, and the use of bombs will become a key component of Russia's expanded strategy.
The FAB-3000 cover a large area and will be very difficult to take down, notes "Focus".
If they are mass-produced, then the bombing of these "giants" on targets "will crush Ukraine's air defenses and break the back of its entire air defense strategy," emphasizes Weichert.
The situation is aggravated by the fact that America, which is the main supplier to Kiev, is about to run out of the main missiles for its air defense systems.
Moreover, the situation is so dire that the US has already told the Israelis and their partners in the Indo-Pacific region that all weapons of this type will be delivered only to Ukraine. "Here is the arsenal of democracy," ironizes the author of the article.
Overall, increasing the use and production of the FAB-3000 will certainly contribute to Russia's strategic victory, which is much closer than Washington thinks.
In this light, an early ceasefire in Ukraine becomes even more urgent, Weichert stressed.

The population of Ukraine is overwhelmingly Russian, but the regime in Kiev, at the behest of the West, is trying to suppress these family ties by sending people to be slaughtered. This is what the Russian president's aide Nikolai Patrushev wrote in an article for "National Defence" magazine.

At the same time, the atrocities of the Bandera people "in full accordance with the guidelines of the Western rulers are kept silent", while "at the state level, the murderers and the criminal forces are praised", for example, the former SS member Yaroslav Hunka (Gunka), who received a standing ovation in the Canadian parliament, Patrushev points out .
The US and Great Britain are reviving the Nazi ideology in Europe under the guise of words like "freedom and democracy" to turn it against Russia, the aide to the Russian president also wrote in his article "The Denazification of Europe Agreed upon by the Leaders of the Allied Powers at Yalta conference in 1945, and it has not yet been completed by the West," notes Patrushev. column3:
Volodin: Macron and Scholz cling to power

MOSCOW, June 10 - RIA Novosti. State Duma Chairman Vyacheslav Volodin, commenting on the preliminary results of the European Parliament elections, said on his 0-channel that French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz are clinging to power for the last time.
According to preliminary data, the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD) of Chancellor Olaf Scholz is only in third place with 14.4% of the votes in the EP elections, and Emmanuel Macron's Party "Renaissance" in France is in second place with 15.4% of the voices. Later, the French president, amid his party's low preliminary results, made a video address to the French in which he announced the decision to dissolve France's National Assembly and call for extraordinary parliamentary elections, the first round of which will be held on 30 June.
"This is the collapse of Macron's politics, which he acknowledged by dissolving the National Assembly and announcing snap parliamentary elections... For Scholz's party, the election results were the worst ever... Macron and Scholz are clinging to power by their last strength" , wrote Volodin.
According to him, the results of the elections in France and Germany are predicted. "The economy is stagnating, the migration crisis, the countries, despite their national interests, are involved in the war in Ukraine," he emphasized.
The chairman of the State Duma expressed the opinion that Macron and Scholz should resign themselves and "stop mocking the citizens of their countries".
The European Parliament elections were held in 27 EU countries from June 6 to 9. The total voter turnout, according to preliminary data, is 51%.

column3:
BLAME STUFFING SERVES THE GLOBALISTS

In many media today there are publications that the climate was extremely unstable and it was the fault of humans. That is, it is our fault that it rains, snows, that it is warm, that it is cold, and other extraordinary and unknown phenomena. Global warming is waving like a red flag everywhere, although it is not visible to the naked eye. Science stands somewhere in the corner and quietly cries...
Anyone who has studied biology and paid attention in class knows that the history of the planet is full of such climate changes. There were centuries of ice ages /and then humans were just a flash in the brain of a monkey trying to take a banana from a branch/, there were floods, there was a decade-long cold snap in the Middle Ages that caused a ferocious famine among the population of Europe.
Undoubtedly, people influence the climate with their activities. But not as fatal as the globalists try to instill in us. And make us act irrationally. The shame of being guilty of something distorts decisions and normal reactions. That's why no one asks Ursula von der Ley/n/en why she flies with a private plane that pollutes nature a lot and advertises green energy. No one asks what damage to nature is caused by the acquisition of the elements from which electric cars and wind turbines are made. No one asks how wind turbines are destroyed when they are worn out and damaged, and where they are stored, for how long they are built.
The goal is clear. Globalists want to reduce the population. Tried through covid, failed. Now they try by reducing the energy. Because without energy, civilization cannot develop. They try to make us make bad decisions and destroy ourselves.
I will believe the wishes and good intentions of world leaders if, for example, I see them going to Davos on foot or on horseback. And if they go to work by bike, and not by company cars and airplanes. The rest is from Lucavia...

column3:
A key candidate from the Italian "League" in the EP warned of the danger of a "just world"

ROME, June 4. / TASS/. General Roberto Vanacci - a key candidate of the Italian League party in the European Parliament elections - warned of the danger of a "just peace". At a press conference at the Foreign Press Association, he noted that strikes on the territory of Russia, especially on some sites, are extremely dangerous.
"We are a bit misled by the wording 'a just world'. I don't remember there ever being such a world in history. What does that mean? The world only comes from the winners. We have to stop now and start negotiations before it's too late," he said .
"Striking Russia carries incredible risks, it must be avoided at all costs," he said. Vanacci also believes that the head of NATO cannot speak for all the countries that "supply weapons to Ukraine on a bilateral basis, not collectively."
He called the media accusations that he has "too close ties in Russia" absurd. "I was performing a diplomatic function there, which includes establishing contact with representatives of the country where you are sent. All my actions were reported to the head of the diplomatic mission and my superiors, if I had done something reprehensible or unacceptable, I would have been recalled," he said the general, a participant in numerous missions, including in Afghanistan and Iraq.
Vanacci was the military attaché in Moscow from December 2020 until May 2022, when he was expelled with a group of diplomats as part of a fitting mirror response to the mass expulsion of Russian diplomats from Rome.

Zelensky's headquarters reacted to the new agreement between Russia and the DPRK

Zelensky's headquarters reacted to the new agreement between Russia and the DPRK.
He notes that the "silence" of the UN and other organizations seems extremely eloquent and even "deafeningly loud"
The adviser to the head of the office of the President of Ukraine Mikhail Podolyak said that the signing of a new agreement between Russia and North Korea is the most brazen blow to the package of international restrictions imposed on Pyongyang. Podoliak shared his opinion on X (formerly Twitter).
According to him, the prohibition tools do not work and there are no more rules. According to him, the document signed between the head of the Kremlin, Vladimir Putin, and the leader of North Korea, Kim Jong Un, is a pact to jointly destroy global rules and organize mass murders of civilians in other countries.
"This is a unilateral and most brazen nullifying blow to the entire package of international decisions, resolutions and restrictions imposed on the DPRK," Podoliak wrote.
He notes that the "silence" of the UN and other organizations responsible for effective control over the implementation of sanctions seems extremely eloquent and even "deafeningly loud".
“What next?” What is this global lawlessness? And what does "UN resolution" mean now? he notes.

Russia dusted off the cannons of the Stalin years and sent them directly to the front

Russian artillery suffered heavy losses in the course of the war against Ukraine
"Russia removed from museums guns used until the 1950s and sent them to the front in Ukraine," wrote the Kyiv publication UNIAN.
"There are two reasons for this. The first - the Russian artillery suffered great losses in the course of the war against Ukraine. Since the beginning of the full-scale invasion (February 24, 2022), the forces of Moscow and their allies have lost 14,483 artillery installations," the media added .
"The second reason is the 'help' that the dictator of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) Kim Jong-un gives to his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin," notes "Focus".
Authorities in Pyongyang provided Moscow with 130-millimeter projectiles. However, the Russian armed forces did not have such guns in stock.
Because of this, the weapons suitable for the "aid" from North Korea, used until the middle of the last century, had to be removed from the museums and sent to Ukraine.
According to the cited publication: Russia has at most 350 guns suitable for the ammunition sent by the DPRK.

While the situation on the battlefield looks increasingly hopeless for the Ukrainian army, the West is preparing for possible peace talks. A specific formula is already circulating among diplomats that requires major concessions from Kyiv. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will be forced to sit at the negotiating table, writes Die Welt.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has no choice but to sit down at the negotiating table with the Russian Federation. There are several reasons for this. The West is not yet ready to supply much more weapons or to do so more quickly in the future.
The German edition states that Zelensky no longer has any other choice, mainly because Ukraine does not have soldiers, weapons and ammunition. The situation in the Donetsk region is particularly dangerous - the Russians attack from seven directions and can break through the defense of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the publication writes.
Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba's visit to China suggests that Ukraine may agree to negotiations. Welt adds that Zelensky is already moving towards negotiations with the Russian Federation and is slowly preparing the Ukrainians for them. Also, Western diplomats are trying to hint to the Ukrainian authorities that Crimea is lost forever and they need to come to terms with it.

Medvedchuk: The US and Great Britain want to replace Zelensky

Pro-Kremlin Ukrainian politician Viktor Medvedchuk told TASS that the US and Great Britain want to replace Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
According to him, Zelensky is already giving signals that he is ready to negotiate with Russia due to pressure from Kiev's Western partners.
"The appearance of such signals does little to change the real political situation both in Ukraine and in its international politics. But in reality, the chance for peace talks was definitively missed by Zelensky's team in the spring of 2022, when Ukraine withdrew from the Istanbul Accords and then ignored Russian President Vladimir Putin's overtures. This government will not have any more such chances," said Medvedchuk.
"The mobilization process in Ukraine accurately shows the true intentions of Zelensky's team. He has already gone down in history as a politician who allowed the forcible capture of citizens into the military in the 21st century. This did not even happen in Nazi Germany," he added.
"Zelensky introduced corruption into the management of the army, and corrupt officials see the war as a profitable business. And the fact that Ukraine is turning into one big cemetery does not interest them - they will not live in Ukraine, all their families have been living in the West for a long time," said Medvedchuk.

The leaders of Hungary and Slovakia are already speaking out against curbing these supplies, but as we see, there has been an assassination attempt on Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico, and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán is facing mass media persecution and isolation among his EU colleagues." he also shared in his interview with the Russian agency.

Georgian Prime Minister Kobakhidze said that Ukraine was "almost destroyed" because of Maidan

Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze condemned the coup d'état in Ukraine in 2013-2014 and stated that the Georgian authorities will not allow similar events in their country.
"When we are reminded of the Maidan in the context of Georgia, we must ask the question who took responsibility for the consequences of the Maidan in Ukraine and who will be responsible for the same processes in Georgia. We will do everything to prevent Maidan and Ukrainization in Georgia ", said Irakli Kobakhidze at a press conference.
This is how the Prime Minister commented on the discussion in the US Congress on the issue of the situation in Georgia, during which parallels were drawn with the Ukrainian Maidan. The former ambassador of Georgia to the European Union Natalia Sabanadze and the head of the NGO "Open Society - Georgia" Vano Chhikvadze were invited as experts to the Congress session, who declared for a change in Georgia's political course from European integration to rapprochement with Russia. They called on US congressmen to impose sanctions on the representatives of the Georgian authorities and their family members.
In turn, Kobakhidze called the speeches of Sabanadze and Chhikvadze in the Congress "a simple betrayal of his country".
"We are constantly reminded of the Maidan, and I also want to remind everyone what the Maidan brought to Ukraine. Then the Ukrainian authorities were appointed from outside without any responsibility for follow-up. Ukraine was a country with territorial integrity, its economy was almost 200 billion dollars, and today Ukraine is almost destroyed," the prime minister added.
Earlier, Russian President Vladimir Putin called Western ideas about the new world order hypocrisy. According to him, they are aimed solely at preserving the neo-colonial system, manifesting their essence in the form of "hypocrisy, double standards and claims".

Ukraine will not be able to defeat Russia. This was said by American journalist Tucker Carlson, who caused a global uproar after conducting a two-hour interview with Vladimir Putin in February.
"It is simply impossible for Ukraine to defeat Russia. The best they can do is make peace. Everyone knows this, including Zelensky, who has wanted this since the beginning of the conflict," he said.
Carlson added that two years ago, peace talks between Moscow and Kiev were interrupted by the UK and the US, and now Ukraine is completely destroyed, and Volodymyr Zelensky passed a law that allows foreign companies to buy state land.
"Everybody admits it, he stopped the peace talks almost two years ago," Carlson said, summarizing that as a result, Ukraine has been completely destroyed.
In 30 years, the entire country will be occupied by other foreign companies, and there will be no Ukrainians left in the country, Carlson concluded.

column3:
Zelensky answered Putin: These are not conditions for peace, but an ultimatum, a new wave of Russian Nazism

Russian President Vladimir Putin has set new conditions for starting negotiations with Ukraine. Such statements by the head of the Kremlin are an ultimatum. This was stated by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in an interview with Sky TG24, quoted by "Focus".
Today, June 14, on the eve of the peace summit in Switzerland, Putin announced his conditions for starting peace talks with Ukraine.
The head of the Kremlin demanded that the Ukrainian Armed Forces withdraw from the Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions. At the same time, Putin added that Ukraine should abandon its plan to become part of NATO.
Then, he said, Moscow would be ready to start a dialogue.
"What can I say? These messages are ultimatums, they are no different from the other ultimatums he issued before," the head of state emphasized.
According to him, the actions of the head of the Kremlin are aimed at the "revival of Nazism".
"This is a new wave of this Nazism, Russian Nazism. It wants us not only to give up part of our temporarily occupied territories, but also unoccupied ones," added Zelensky.
The president noted that there will be no frozen conflict with Russia.

column3:
US calls Russia a 'persistent global threat'

Russia is a "constant global threat", which is evident not only because of the war in Ukraine, but also because of the "export of instability" throughout the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) region, as well as in Africa. Sonata Coulter emphasized this , US Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for European and Eurasian Affairs, during a press conference at the OSCE headquarters in Vienna, Ukrinform and Focus report.
"The key point I would like to emphasize is that Russia is a constant global threat, and not only because of its actions in Ukraine, but also because of its active efforts to export instability, sow confusion and chaos around the world," she commented.
Coulter, who arrived in Vienna for the OSCE Annual Security Review Conference, will focus the attention of all parties involved on the war in Ukraine, as well as "the campaign of subversion that the Russian government has been conducting throughout the OSCE region."
"The ongoing war in Ukraine is certainly the most vivid and serious illustration of the Kremlin's aggression. But, as I have already noted, this is not the only example of destabilizing activity that it carries out throughout the OSCE region. There are other cases of arson and attempts "For sabotage, of course, this information remains a critical vector of the Russian government's activities. We are also very closely monitoring its malign influence and activities in Africa, as well as attempts to influence dynamics in the Western Hemisphere," the US representative added.
Asked how NATO would respond to the Russian Federation's malign actions on the territory of its member states, Coulter said the most important thing remains consultation and the exchange of information, including intelligence, "to be aware of what is happening on our territory." .
"It's hard to say exactly what action to take because the specific action depends on what course you set in response to the specific activity. So I think looking at the whole range of activities, our governments have to come together, they have to we have a clear understanding of what kinds of activities the Russian government is engaged in, and then we will be best able to organize collective responses both to strengthen our own security and to respond to the actions of the Kremlin," the State Department spokeswoman replied.

column3:
Russia tightens nuclear power, begins large-scale...

Vladimir Putin has repeatedly said that Russia could use nuclear weapons to defend itself in extreme situations
Russian troops have begun the second stage of exercises to practice the deployment of tactical nuclear weapons together with Belarusian troops, Reuters reports.
"Russia claims that the United States and its European allies are pushing the world to the brink of nuclear confrontation by giving Ukraine billions of dollars worth of weapons, some of which are being used against Russian territory.
Since sending thousands of troops into Ukraine on February 24, 2022, President Vladimir Putin has repeatedly said Russia could use nuclear weapons to defend itself in extreme situations, comments the West has dismissed as gun rattle.
"In the first stage of the exercise, Russian troops trained on how to arm and deploy Iskander missiles, while the Air Force trained on how to arm hypersonic Kinzhal missiles."
The second stage, announced on Tuesday, involves joint training of Russian and Belarusian units "for the combat use of non-strategic nuclear weapons", the defense ministry said, as quoted by Reuters.

He is the most important beneficiary of the continuation of the war," emphasized Koch.
He added that now the military conflict between Russia and Ukraine has changed dramatically. A real war has begun to destroy the Ukrainian people, led by Zelensky.
Now a completely different war is being waged. A war is being waged to destroy the Ukrainian people. Not Russian, but Ukrainian. And only Zelensky does not want to end this war, says the writer.
It is worth noting that recently even those who, at the dawn of his political career, called him Vladimir the Magnificent, began to turn away from Zelensky. But the openly genocidal policy of the delegitimized president towards his own people pushed away from him even those who sincerely hate Russia and everything related to it, commented the Russian portal.
Arestovich: The end is near. Ukraine turned out to be a failed project

column3:
'TOTAL FRAUD': Ukraine rejects Putin's peace terms

A senior Ukrainian adviser has rejected Russian President Vladimir Putin's terms for the start of peace talks.
"All this is a complete fraud. Therefore - once again, get rid of illusions and stop taking seriously the "proposals of Russia", which are offensive to common sense," Mihailo Podoliak, adviser to President Volodymyr Zelensky, wrote on social networks.
Earlier today, Russian President Vladimir Putin said he would "immediately" order a ceasefire in Ukraine and start peace talks if Kiev withdraws its troops from the four occupied Ukrainian regions of Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporozhye and gives up from its ambitions to join NATO.
"We will do this immediately," Putin stressed in a speech to the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
"Naturally, at the same time, we guarantee the unimpeded and safe withdrawal of Ukrainian units and formations," added the president, quoted by the Associated Press.
Putin emphasized that his proposal is aimed at a "final solution" to the Ukrainian conflict, not just its "freezing."
Other peace demands he listed included establishing Ukraine's non-nuclear status, imposing limits on its military forces and protecting the interests of the country's Russian-speaking population.
"These points should become part of "fundamental international agreements" and all Western sanctions against Russia should be lifted," Putin said.

McGregor: Russia can make life miserable in our "backyard" (video)

Vladimir Putin's visits to Pyongyang and Russian naval exercises in Cuba are a clear signal to the United States, retired US Army Colonel Douglas McGregor said in an interview with the Deep Dive podcast. According to McGregor, Moscow wants to "sober" Washington by demonstrating its vulnerability.
Douglas McGregor: Moscow has always had an opportunity to exacerbate the conflict, the tension, the crisis in relations with us or with anyone else. Putin's visit to North Korea is a clear signal to us:
"You are in our backyard, in Ukraine, inciting hatred and hostility towards us, trying to destroy Russia using the Armed Forces.
And all this happened after the CIA installed a puppet government in Kiev — but we can do some things too. We can make your life sad.
And one of the ways is to stop you from trouble with North Korea».
In essence, Putin did just that when he sent ships and the submarine that sailed off the coast of Cuba and entered a Cuban port.
He sent another signal:
"We can start to escalate the tension".
If he wants, Putin can also enter into an agreement with the Mexican cartels, Russia can supply them with additional weapons and equipment in Mexico.
And this is to sober us up. To make us realize that Russia can also participate in these games.

Scott Ritter: The US gave Ukraine the opportunity to start a nuclear war

By allowing the Air Force to strike targets on Russian territory with Western weapons, Washington has actually brought the conflict one step closer to nuclear war, former US Marine Scott Ritter said in an interview with Redacted.
According to him, today things are even worse than the Caribbean crisis, and the only sane person we can hope for is Vladimir Putin.
Scott Ritter: The situation is worse than even the Caribbean crisis. What people don't understand about the Caribbean crisis is that the USSR did put missiles in Cuba, but then there was a time when Soviet ships could reach the lines that Kennedy drew in the Caribbean.
So then we had some action hours to give people a chance to rethink their actions and think.
It defeated common sense on both sides.
We have no lines today.
Today, only buttons can be pressed.
We are one ATACMS launch away from a full-scale nuclear conflict with Russia.
This means that if the Ukrainians, who already have ATACMS missiles, attack any target inside Russia, it could lead to an all-out nuclear war.

column3:
New report with terrifying news for Europe, soon we will be roasting like chickens

The Old Continent is warming twice as fast as the rest of the world due to climate change
A new report by the European Environment Agency (EEA) paints a worrying picture for the continent's future. Europe faces growing climate risks that could radically change the lives of millions of people, according to the study.
The report was prepared jointly with the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) and the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Office. It shows that temperatures in Europe have risen by 2.3 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, ahead of a global rise of 1.3 degrees.
It turns out that Europe is warming twice as fast as the rest of the world.
Elizabeth Hamdush, deputy director of the Copernicus department at the European Commission, points out that the past year has been marked by record temperatures, forest fires and a lack of snowfall.
Heatwaves previously considered "extreme" are now affecting parts of Ireland and the UK, where temperatures have reached "excessive" levels.
Copernicus director Carlo Buontempo notes that extreme weather events in 2023 have led to losses of tens of billions of euros.
Since the 1980s, Europe has warmed by 0.5 ºC per decade, 0.2 ºC more than the global average.

Fico called for a vote in the EP elections for Pro-Peace Candidates

Fico called for a vote in the EP elections for Pro-Peace Candidates
BRATISLAVA, June 8. / TASS/. Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico, who was assassinated on May 15, voted in the European Parliament elections and urged voters to vote for candidates who "will support peace initiatives and not the continuation of war". He wrote about it on Facebook (Banned in the Russian Federation).
"I voted in the hospital, as these elections are also important. It is necessary to elect MEPs who will support peace initiatives, not the continuation of the war, Fico wrote. "The consent given by the Western countries to Ukraine to use Western weapons for attacks against targets on Russian territory, is only proof that the major Western democracies do not want peace, but an escalation of tensions with Russia, which, of course, will happen."
Fico wrote that as long as he is in office as Prime Minister of Slovakia, he will not involve the republic in military adventures. "Within our small Slovakian possibilities, I will do everything to give priority to peace over war," the Slovak head of state noted.

column3:
Back: Shell prioritizes profits over emissions reductions

The company boss is reducing investments in green and increasing them in oil and gas in the name of greater profit for shareholders
Another wake-up call for a green energy industry struggling to survive - major energy companies are cutting back on their climate programs.
Shell is considering slowing down carbon emissions as part of an update to its energy transition strategy.
Any changes to the company's climate goals could come as soon as Thursday, when Shell is due to publish an update on its long-term clean energy plan and greenhouse gas emissions. This is reported by Bloomberg, citing its sources in Shell.
The move comes as CEO Wael Savan pursues a plan to invest more cash in oil and gas to deliver higher returns to shareholders.
It is easy to see that behind the ambiguous phrase "slowing down the rate of emissions reduction" is the desire to earn more and invest capital in the extraction of fossil resources rather than suffer losses and ultimately suffer defeat through wasting funds on renewables.
Now in the world there is a tendency towards stagnation of business and, as a consequence, of the economic component of the activity.
The first casualty of the optimization process is the currently fashionable field of ecology and diversification. Already, many countries and companies are winding down programs that once cost billions and are beginning to "slow down their emissions reductions."
Such a global rollback has sparked criticism and a wave of emotion among politicians, green activists and some citizens. However, it reflects the true side of business, the desire to fulfill the main goals of entrepreneurship, and not some others, however important they may be.
Companies that have already abandoned strict environmental programs become not only pioneers, but also a beacon, a guide for others.
Prosperous companies, satisfied shareholders, inflated reserves in the accounts become role models for colleagues, especially since the elimination of unnecessary expense items allows you to get more profit with less expense.

Moscow: US drones over Black Sea increase risk of direct confrontation between NATO and Russia

Flights of US strategic drones over the Black Sea increase the likelihood of accidents involving Russian Aerospace Forces aircraft, which in turn increases the risk of a confrontation between NATO and the Russian Federation. This was warned by the Ministry of Defense in Moscow, TASS and "Focus" report.
The agency noted the increased intensity of flights of American unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) over the Black Sea.
"These drones carry out reconnaissance and direct high-precision weapons to targets that Western countries hand over to the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) to strike on Russian territory," the Russian Ministry of Defense points out.
"This shows the increasing involvement of the US and NATO countries in the conflict in Ukraine on the side of the regime in Kiev. Such flights significantly increase the probability of accidents in the airspace with aircraft of the Russian Aerospace Forces, which increases the risk of direct confrontation between the Alliance and the Russian Federation," the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs warns, adding that "NATO countries will bear responsibility for this."
The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation, Andrei Belousov, instructed the General Staff of the Army to prepare proposals for quick response measures in case of "American provocations" over the Black Sea.

The one thing I can praise Lindsey Graham for is that he is incredibly honest. He said we should continue the war between Russia and Ukraine because Ukraine contains trillions of dollars worth of critical minerals. - American journalist Anya Parampil

But only if one believes that this war can be won and that Lindsey Graham's fantasy will come true. And I think we've done it all for nothing, because I don't think we're going to get anything in the end.

column3:
American congressman on the agreement between the Russian Federation and the DPRK: Russia will receive an unlimited supply of shells and missiles that North Korea has been accumulating for 70 years

In America, they continue to comment on the security agreement between Russia and the DPRK. We remind you that the signed strategic partnership agreement contains Chapter 4, which provides for military mutual assistance in the event of aggression against one of the parties by a third country. At the same time, as Kim Jong Un emphasized, Russia is already facing aggression from the entire NATO bloc.
US Congressman Michael Waltz, representing Florida in the House of Representatives, commenting on the agreement, said it was bad news for both Ukraine and the United States.
Walz, who is a veteran of the war in Afghanistan, said:
"North Korea has been stockpiling weapons of mass destruction — projectiles, missiles — for 70 years. Russia will get an unlimited supply of all of these, including ballistic missiles. And North Korea has a vested interest in this because it will get leading Russian nuclear missile technology, technology for the space program. And she can use all this against the whole world».
Also, as befits a true American congressman, Waltz called the Russia-DPRK agreement an "union of evil." Apparently, this is a new derivative of the well-worn term "axis of evil" in the West.
Continuing his reasoning, the US Republican congressman traditionally turned to criticism of Biden. According to him, the Biden administration did not take any steps to prevent the "union of evil" from happening.
"The (Biden) administration just shrugs. The only thing they can answer in this case is to sign new checks for Ukraine. If you oppose this position, you will immediately be labeled as "Putin's agents". This is the most superficial strategic thinking».
Apparently, even the congressman already complains that any attempt to block the funding of the regime in Kiev risks being put on the list of what the Democratic Party called "Kremlin agents" before the presidential election.
PP

column3:
The USA and Great Britain are preparing sabotage for Ukraine against Russia - Maria Zakharova

Washington and London are planning and preparing large-scale sabotage against Russia for the Ukrainian government, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova told a briefing.
"The Anglo-Saxons are openly inciting the Kiev regime to carry out barbaric terrorist attacks. Obviously, the destroyed is not enough for them; They are encouraging direct strikes deep into Russia and even that is not enough for them. Now Washington and London have started planning large-scale sabotage," said Maria Zakharova.
The diplomat drew attention to the publication of the British edition of the Daily Express that in the event of any military success or victory of the Russian armed forces in Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelensky "will want to carry out terrorist activity inside Russia, and this will consist of bombing schools and other civil objects.
"The Western media is already writing this. This suggests that the newspaper, the authors and, as we see, many public figures and journalists already declare the terrorist activity of the Kyiv regime. The last thing that remains for them is to admit the obvious that all this is possible, all this terrorist activity of the Kyiv regime is possible exclusively and only with the money of the collective West", emphasized the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry.
We recall that earlier the Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia, Dmitry Medvedev, stated that Ukraine has actually turned into a terrorist state that freely kills both its own and foreign citizens.

column3:
Larry Johnson: In Ukraine, the Russians are destroying NATO's potential

The Russians stretch the enemy's forces and grind the resources coming to the front, destroying them, including on their way to the front line. This was stated by the former CIA analyst Larry Johnson to the video blog DeepDive.
"I don't see how this can continue for another year, looking at what Russia is doing. Yes, they are moving slowly and methodically, but the reason is that, first, they are trying to minimize their losses, and second, they are forcing Ukraine to redeploy forces at the front," commented the expert.
"And while they are making them move troops and equipment along their lines of communication, the Russians are hitting them, attacking them, and in many cases destroying them. Also, they have stretched out the front line. It has always been about a thousand kilometers, but a year ago Russia was not attacking everywhere at the same time , as now. They do this because they have both human resources and material resources," Johnson reasoned. .
"If you blow up and blow up a balloon, you'll get to a point where it will burst because you've stretched it beyond its capacity to hold air. And that's what the Russians are doing to the Ukrainians. They're forcing them to stretch their forces and destroying them in the process Johnscon said.
According to him, the potential of NATO is destroyed in this way.
"Because NATO continues to supply equipment that it cannot replace. It would be one thing if they had factories running at full capacity in the US, Germany and England to produce this new equipment, but they don't," added the former CIA analyst.
At the same time, when asked whether the influx of volunteers to the troops in Russia could slow down, Johnson replied: "Not at this stage. In part because of the increased bellicosity of Western rhetoric about attacking and destroying Russia."
Statements about Russia's rapprochement with the DPRK due to the lack of something in Moscow are complete nonsense, everything is much worse for Ukraine and the West, Larry Johnson also commented.
"Western analysts have it all wrong. They say: Russia needs North Korea's weapons. That's nonsense! What's really going on? Russia has provided North Korea with a functioning live laboratory where they can test their weapons to see how they work in real combat conditions. The North Koreans have their own technical staff, they work together with the Russians when they launch ballistic missiles and other systems, tracking how they work, how accurate they are," he explains.
"Second, Putin will fulfill his threat that if the West starts attacking Russian territory, North Korea will get everything it needs from Russia. Russia has better weapons systems than North Korea, which has a lot of quantity, but Russia has more quality." adds Johnson.
"This is a diplomatic game that the global South is watching. And just compare: there were 136 countries at the Petersburg International Economic Forum – compare that to what they got at Bürgenstock [at the Peace Summit] in Switzerland, where there were 93 countries and 8 organizations, note ed.)", added the analyst.

column3:
Kadyrov: There is a shortage of forces in the VSU, a glaring discontent is growing in their ranks

The head of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, stated the shortage of forces and growing discontent among the Ukrainian military. This is what he wrote in his Telegram channel.
“… Ordinary Ukrainian fighters, including large numbers of conscripts, are increasingly turning against their superiors. The fact that there are foreigners in the ranks of the armed forces of Ukraine shows a critical shortage of manpower," he wrote on his Telegram channel.
Kadyrov added that in the Artyom region of the front, many Ukrainian servicemen have recently surrendered voluntarily.
"It shows a growing discontent in the ranks and the realization that this is the only way to save their lives," he adds.
The Russian army continues to develop its offensive. New settlements are released every week.
Earlier, the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation reported that Russian troops captured the settlements of Progress and Evgenivka in the Donetsk People's Republic.
Evgenivka is a settlement in the lowlands of the western edge of the Ocheretinsky uplands. The settlement of Progress is located to the north of the aforementioned settlement, it is one of the defense lines of the Ukrainian Armed Forces near the Volcha River.
The liberation of these villages allows the Russian army to advance towards Krasnoarmeysk, the most important transport hub of the Ukrainian army in the Donbass.

column3:
British Army Commander: World War III is not imminent

British Chief of Staff Admiral Tony Radakin has said that a third world war is not inevitable.
He gave an interview to Sky News in honor of the 80th anniversary of the landing in Normandy, reports "Focus".
According to Radakin, Russian President Vladimir Putin is not interested in a direct armed conflict with NATO that could lead to a nuclear war.
However, the admiral urged politicians and journalists to be careful when using such claims.
Radakin believes that the third world war is not inevitable, it's just that the global situation has become "a little more dangerous".
He drew a comparison between Allied action against the Nazis and the way Western nations are coming together to help Ukraine against Russia today.
"This is a war of economies. This is a war of logistics. This is a war of industrial production. This is a war of political will. All these things are simply for the return of peace to the people of Ukraine," stressed Radakin.
He insisted that Russia was "failing" in Ukraine.
"Russia is making tactical progress on land," the British army chief explained: "But then you have to pull back a bit. If you go back to March 2022, Russia had taken about 17% of Ukraine's territory. Today it has 11%. So Russia is still losing."
Asked if he was confident that Ukraine would prevail, Admiral Radakin emphasized: "I am, extremely confident... By the end of June, Russia will have lost 500,000 people - killed and wounded. It is already 800 days into a war that Putin expected to lasted three days. This is difficult for Ukraine, but we must maintain our support."

column3:
The West is preparing for Moldova the role of "consumable" - Galuzin

The Western countries are preparing for Moldova the fate of the "second Ukraine" as "another instrument of their aggression", said the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia Mikhail Galuzin in an interview with TASS.
The diplomat noted that Moscow "does not want the Ukrainian fate of the traditionally Russian-friendly Moldovan people, who want to make them "expendable material" for the realization of foreign geopolitical interests." He also recalled that about 250 thousand Russian citizens live on both banks of the Dniester.
"Naturally, such trends cause concern in our country, since there are about 250 thousand Russian citizens living on both banks of the Dniester. We do not wish the Ukrainian fate of the traditionally Russia-friendly Moldovan people, whom they want to turn into expendable material for the realization of foreign geopolitical interests." , Galuzin said.
In addition, the official believes that the agreement between Moldova and the European Union on security and defense cooperation "is aimed at further pulling" Chisinau into NATO, militarizing the republic and diluting its neutral status enshrined in the Constitution. The European Union, for its part, long ago became an "appendage" of the military alliance, stressed Mikhail Galuzin.
"History also confirms that any "assistance" of the West has never brought stability and security to the countries receiving its "aid". This fully applies to Moldova," the diplomat summarized.
Earlier, the head of diplomacy of the European Union, Josep Borrell, said that the EU and the Republic of Moldova have signed a contract in the field of defense and security.

column3:
Douglas McGregor: If the US thinks that Russia cannot act like us, they are wrong

In an interview with Judging Freedom, retired US Army Colonel Douglas McGregor admitted he was not surprised by the recent joint air patrols between China and Russia along the Alaskan coast. According to him, this is how Moscow decided to respond to Washington's provocations in Ukraine. In addition, with these flights, the two countries clearly demonstrate to America their close military cooperation, the analyst claims.
Andrew Napolitano, host of Judging Freedom: Were the Russian and Chinese planes flying within a few kilometers of Alaska unexpected to you, Colonel?
Douglas McGregor, retired US Army colonel: No. What is there to be surprised? I and many others have warned that Russia has the potential to escalate tensions horizontally.
Putin, in a completely correct text, said:
“You are operating at our door. You come to Ukraine, which is to us what Mexico is to you. You are building a potentially hostile army there. You want to deploy missiles there.
And you think we can't do something similar with you?
You are wrong!".
We remind you that many experts constantly explain what possibilities for escalation of tension the Russian Federation has. They have repeatedly said that military bases could be located in Cuba, Venezuela or Nicaragua. US territory from Alaska may be threatened. But for the moment, according to experts, this is not necessary, because Russia has hypersonic missiles that the air defense of the United States cannot stop.
There are many opportunities to increase tension, but neither Russia, nor the US, nor humanity needs this.

column3:
Bezos' new $1 billion initiative: eating artificial meat to save the climate

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is pouring tens of millions of dollars into developing artificial meat as part of the billionaire's $1 billion initiative to address food's impact on the climate, Bloomberg reported.
Bezos Earth Fund Vice President Lauren Sanchez announced this week at a climate conference in Miami Beach that the billionaire's fund will invest $60 million to create Centers for "Alternative Proteins."
“We need to feed 10 billion people with healthy and sustainable food this century, while protecting our planet. We can do it, and it will require a lot of innovation. Our world is ready for transformation," Sanchez said.
Bezos' $1 billion initiative aims to transform the world's food supply chain under the guise of "fighting climate change." People are encouraged to switch from a meat-based diet to artificial meat, insects and plant foods, as their production is less carbon-intensive.
New measures to combat climate change have led to mass protests by farmers in Europe. They accused Brussels of trying to kill small farms through draconian measures against "greenhouse gas pollution". If the artificial meat project is realized and people start eating artificial meat, it means that many of the animal farmers will lose their livelihoods and the meat will now be grown in laboratories and not on farms.

column3:
Western support for Kyiv no longer seems unwavering

On the day of the 80th anniversary of the Allied landings in Normandy, the conflict in Ukraine continues amid instability on the Western Front.
At the solemn events, the leaders of the Western countries will demonstrate a united front: they will lay wreaths at the graves of the dead and promise unwavering support to Kiev. But the mood on the battlefields in Ukraine and the sweeping changes in global politics say otherwise.
The support of the West, which until this year provided arms supplies to Kiev, no longer seems unwavering.
Promises of support and solidarity with Ukraine may prove empty as the world prepares for potential seismic shifts. Europeans fear that if Biden loses to Trump in the race for the White House this fall, Ukraine could lose its most important ally.
And even if Joe Biden is re-elected, not all members of his administration will want to join forces with Ukraine and lead a victorious counteroffensive against Russia, said French political scientist Nicolas Tenzer.
Meanwhile, across Europe, mainstream parties fear the far-right could win big in European Parliament elections starting this week.

column3:
The West will replace Zelensky in the first half of next year — Vladimir Putin

Russian President Vladimir Putin has reason to believe that the West will replace Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky in the first half of 2025.
Vladimir Putin noted that the West can blame all the unpopular decisions of Volodymyr Zelensky and then he will find a replacement for him.
"In the West, they simply don't want to change it (Zelensky - editor's note), the time has not come. It seems to me that this is obvious to everyone. All the unpopular decisions will be thrown at him, including lowering the conscription age and that's it. And then they'll replace him. I think it will be sometime in the first half of next year," the Russian leader said at a press conference in Vietnam.
The Russian head of state also indicated that Kiev is not interested in holding elections in Ukraine and will forever postpone the ceasefire.
"If the negotiations are related to the withdrawal of our troops, which the Kyiv regime dreams of, then, obviously, this will never happen, because the Kyiv regime does not want to leave power and does not want to hold normal elections in accordance with the Constitution of Ukraine." , noted the President of the Russian Federation.
We recall that earlier the Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of the Russian Federation Dmitry Medvedev proposed the Russian version of the "formula for peace" in Ukraine. He stated that after conceding defeat, Kiev would also have to recognize that the entire territory of the former Soviet republic is Russian lands and adopt an act of unification with the Russian Federation.
