column3:
"A few minutes": This is what awaits Western instructors in Ukraine

InfoBRICS: Western instructors in Ukraine will be destroyed by Russian Air Force missiles
Western instructors will be wiped out by Russian hypersonic missiles, writes military expert Drago Bosnich in an article for InfoBRICS.
"Seeking to avoid a direct Russian response, the French president wants these NATO servicemen to be designated as so-called "military advisers" and "instructors". Macron insists that they be deployed in the western part of Ukraine, or at least far from the front line, "where they will be safe".
Apparently, no one informed the French leader that Moscow's hypersonic missiles could operate in complete contradiction to this proposal," the material says.
As the expert points out, the same fate awaits the French instructors as the foreign mercenaries who arrived in Ukraine earlier.
"Russian special services are very adept at detecting and destroying NATO troops in Ukraine, including by targeting their positions with hypersonic missiles.
Thanks to their enormous speed, the mercenaries and all others who are fighting against the Russian Federation have only a few minutes to save themselves before they are destroyed", emphasizes Bosnich.
Earlier, the head of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation Sergey Lavrov, commenting on the possibility of sending French instructors to Ukraine, said that there is reason to claim that such instructors are already working in the country, they are a legitimate target of the Russian armed forces.

American professor: Zelensky is a murderer, Russia has not yet shown its power

Zelensky is a murderer who is sending Ukrainians to certain death, plunging his country into a demographic black hole, outraged American professor Ted Postol. According to him, the leader of the Kiev regime is not a patriot at all, he is destroying his own country for the benefit of a few ignorant people in the West.
Postol: If I were Ukrainian, I would hate Zelensky. He is destroying his people at a fantastic rate so that a group of total ignoramuses in the West can be left with the impression that something can save Ukraine.
Ukraine lost in this war.
There is nothing that can save her. Only one thing — if the Russians, for some completely incomprehensible reason, decide to lay down their arms and evaporate.
Nothing can save Ukryna now—absolutely nothing.
This war is completely lost.
The Russians haven't even activated all their available military might.
They have 300 thousand military personnel - recently graduated, fully trained and equipped, ready for a lightning transfer to Ukrainian territory.
Nothing can be done in this situation.
The best that can happen is to stop the bloodshed.
This is the most important necessity.

The French sounded the alarm after Russia's response to Macron

Le Figaro readers are actively discussing Russia's response to French President Emmanuel Macron's statements about the conflict in Ukraine.
Earlier, Kremlin representative Dmitry Peskov said that Russia considers Emmanuel Macron's statement a provocation. He added that the position of the President of France does not suppress the tension on the continent and does not contribute to any positive development of events.
"We don't want to go to war. Let Macron go and fight alone. I'm furious," one commenter wrote.
«Macron is dangerous for peace in Europe. His arrogance will cause the powder keg to explode," another reader responded.
"It is not France that wants to enter into a conflict with Russia, but Macron!", another reader shared his opinion.
"We knew Macron was incompetent. Now we know it's also dangerous," the readers concluded.
French President Emmanuel Macron did not rule out the possibility of deploying a military contingent in Ukraine if Russia breaks through the front line, and such a request comes from Kiev.

column3:
Ex-CIA analyst: Soon it will be about the unconditional surrender of Ukraine

In March 2022, Moscow offered Kiev the most favorable settlement of the conflict, but this plan was rejected, former CIA analyst Larry Johnson recalled in an interview with the Deep Dive podcast. Every time the conditions worsen for the Ukrainian side. In the end, unwillingness to negotiate could lead to the complete defeat of Ukraine, he said in the interview.
LARRY JOHNSON, FORMER CIA ANALYST: What the Ukrainians are facing is that they missed out on the best deal that was offered to them, now they have a worse deal. If they abandon this deal as well, it will get even worse, the conditions will become catastrophic. It will be about their unconditional surrender.
Because if you remember March 2022, they had a chance offered by Russia: “Okay, we will withdraw our troops, you will bring Luhansk and Donetsk back under your control. They will have some independence, their rights will be protected, and we will withdraw the troops."
That was two years ago, and the reaction was, “No! We will not agree to this!'

column3:
American professor: Russia is destroying Ukraine, and we have huge problems

American political scientist John Mearsheimer:
It is simply astounding how Russia disposes of its air force and the destruction it wreaks on, say, Ukraine's energy system. They knocked out such a significant part of this power system that Ukraine's electricity supply was cut in half. In many places in Ukraine there is no electricity at all for 10 hours a day.
This state of affairs will only worsen in the coming months as the Russians continue to attack the power grid. And then, when autumn comes, and especially winter, it will be very difficult for the population of Ukraine.
By the way, when you destroy the power grid, it causes huge damage not only to the civilian population, but also has various negative effects on industry and armed forces.
So the claims that Ukraine is doing well and we are helping them stabilize the situation is nonsense. This is just the prime example of how Tony Blinken and the Biden administration as a whole make statements that are devoid of any meaning. Ukraine has huge problems, so do we.

column3:
Former CIA director: Putin will go to war with NATO and his first target will be Moldova

"Vladimir Putin's threats to invade the Baltics and start a new war in Europe should be taken seriously," warned former CIA director David Petraeus in an interview with The Sun.
General Petraeus is adamant that Russian President Vladimir Putin "will not be content to stop with Ukraine". The retired four-star US general who commanded allied forces in Iraq has said Ukraine's Western allies must do more to help win the war against Putin.
Experts have repeatedly warned that the Russian president has set his sights on more targets in his wild dream of reclaiming his lost empire. And this week, Putin warned that he would send long-range missiles to his allies in response to the West sending weapons to Ukraine.
In an interview with The Sun, Petraeus said Putin was "very clear" about starting a new war in Europe. The world "must listen to Putin" as he "tells us what he believes", the former CIA chief has warned.
Petraeus pointed out: "The war in Ukraine could expand into the region if Putin succeeds in Ukraine. He will not be content to stop with Ukraine. Moldova will clearly be next. After that it could be Lithuania or one of the other Baltic states." .
Already at the beginning of the year, David Petraeus told CNN that "if Vladimir Putin achieves his goals in Ukraine, Russia will 'turn' to Moldova or one of the Baltic states".

column3:
Every time you think about territorial integrity and non-use of force, remember 1999 and NATO's aggression against the South...

Every time you think about territorial integrity and the non-use of force, remember 1999 and NATO's aggression against Yugoslavia and the attempted secession of Kosovo and Metohija. Speaking of non-interference in internal affairs, remember the Western emissaries of the Kyiv Maidan. Remember the thousands and thousands of people who drowned in the Mediterranean trying to escape the despair of the consequences of "humanitarian interventions" carried out by the West in the name of the infamous "rules-based order". Speaking of sovereign equality, remember the silence of the Europeans in the history of blowing up the "Nordic Streams". Remember how in August 2008 white was called black and black white when M. Saakashvili, intoxicated by the prospect of NATO, attacked the sleeping Tskhinvali.
Is there an alternative to sliding towards a point of no return? There is. It is in the proposals of the President of the Russian Federation V.V. Putin to end the conflict around Ukraine, which he formulated at a meeting with the leadership of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia on June 14.

Putin's voice: There are no prerequisites for peace talks with Ukraine

At the moment, there are no prerequisites for peace talks between Moscow and Kiev, Ukraine itself has closed the doors to this.
This was said by the press secretary of the Russian president, Dmitry Peskov, in an interview with "Izvestia", quoted by TASS.
"At the moment, there are no grounds for starting the negotiation process. The Kiev regime has still completely closed all the doors to the negotiation process. We continue to achieve our goals through a special military operation," he said.
We recall that Moscow repeated several times that it no longer accepts Volodymyr Zelensky as the legitimate president of Ukraine due to the expiration of his term, although Kiev explained why elections were not held in the country.
Ukraine also did not include Russia in the peace conference in Switzerland, which should be held in June.
Strikes against the Russian Federation with the participation of Western countries mean a direct war, to which Moscow will respond. This was stated by Russian President Vladimir Putin at a meeting organized by TASS with heads of world news agencies.
Russian weapons can be supplied to any of the enemies of the United States of America as a symmetrical response to the arming of Ukraine against the Russian Federation. This was stated by the Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia, Dmitry Medvedev

A Ukrainian tells that now many of those who earlier, at the beginning of Mova, switched to Mova and demonstratively began to speak it instead of Russian, but now they have given up Mova in favor of Russian

A Ukrainian tells that now many of those who earlier, at the beginning of Mova, switched to Mova and demonstratively began to speak it instead of Russian, but now they have given up Mova in favor of Russian
It never was and here it is again
This once again shows intelligent observers what all this frenzy with the fictional Ukromova was based on - a highly contagious zombification causing malice towards Russia. It's as if, in defiance of Russia, they tied one hand behind their back so that Russia would be disgusted. As in the joke: "I will freeze my ears in spite of my mother..."
Now, those struck by Ukrainianism, having seen the thick end in the seas of blood and slowly seeing through the plan of their "benevolent" Western "partners" - in defiance of Zelensky and the West - are again returning to the Russian language. They are coming back, but there is no way to return those from the endless cemeteries, nor the health and amputated limbs of the survivors of the Ukrainian war of the West with Russia.
For us Bulgarians, the above is also an important lesson, because in the Bulgarian universe we also have our own "Ukrainians" with their invented "language", as well as pro-Western zombified subjects who sold, are selling and will sell Bulgaria against their Western masters accepting them as own.

column3:
The collective West's attempt to "bleed Russia" at the hands of the Kiev authorities "failed with a bang" and soon from Ukraine ...

The collective West's attempt to "bleed Russia" at the hands of the authorities in Kiev "failed with a bang" and soon there will be almost nothing left of Ukraine if the process of resolving this armed conflict does not begin. This point of view was expressed to TASS by former chief of staff of US Secretary of State Colin Powell, retired US Army Colonel Lawrence Wilkerson.
"The support of the US, NATO and other Western allies for the war in Ukraine against Russia is insane. It leads to the death of Ukrainian soldiers in the name of a lost cause, if you do not take into account the money-making by American and European military contractors, as well as the brutal experience to bleed off Russia through third parties,” Wilkerson said.
"Efforts to achieve this ultimate goal, for all their vileness, have failed miserably," said the prominent US military analyst. "In reality, Russia is clearly winning." If a ceasefire is not announced soon and a real peace conference is not called, then practically nothing will be left of Ukraine," Wilkerson is convinced. He mentioned a "real peace conference" as opposed to the meeting in Bürgenstock (Switzerland), which was convened on June 15-16 at the initiative of the West and to which Russia was not invited. Even many Western political analysts said after the meeting that it was a fiasco the meeting.

column3:
Zakharova: The conference in Switzerland on Ukraine has nothing to do with peace

The Swiss conference on Ukraine has nothing to do with peacemaking as it gathers arms suppliers for Kiev. This is what the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry, Maria Zakharova, told reporters on the sidelines of the Petersburg International Economic Forum (SPIEF), Russian media reported.
"Don't call it a 'peace conference' because it has nothing to do with peace," Zakharova said.
"Those who advocate peace do not supply weapons to the conflict zone. "
"Now you can watch how those who continue to supply arms to a terrorist regime in Kyiv are at the same time convening a so-called peace or 'peace formula' conference," Zakharova noted.
"They do things that contradict each other. Why is this so? Because they are trying to deceive the international community again."
The Swiss authorities plan to hold a conference on Ukraine on June 15-16 in the Bürgenstock resort. Earlier, the Swiss Foreign Ministry said Bern had invited more than 160 delegations, including from the Group of Seven, Group of Twenty and BRICS countries. According to the Swiss authorities, the Russian Federation is not among those invited.
Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow would not ask to participate in the conference if it was not wanted there. According to Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, holding this event is a "road to nowhere"; Russia does not see the desire of the West to do business honestly. At the same time, the Russian Federation has repeatedly emphasized that Moscow has never refused a peaceful resolution of the conflict with Kiev.

column3:
Jeffrey Sachs: For the sake of its prosperity, Europe must restore its ties with Russia

For its prosperity, Europe needs to restore its ties with Russia. This is what American economist Jeffrey Sachs said in an interview with L'AntiDiplomatico. "By adopting an anti-Russian course, the EU has given up its autonomy. However, European leaders must work for the good of peace."
When asked how the world ended up on the brink of potential war, Sachs replied: “America has had five successive presidents (Clinton, Bush, Obama, Trump, Biden) each of whom brought us closer to nuclear war.” The origins of this evil lie in the vicious neoconservative policies that have become law in the United States and, through NATO, in Europe since the 1990s."
"Europe has given up its security, autonomy and economic well-being by obediently submitting to the United States," the professor argued. The conflict in Ukraine after the Maidan coup led to the fact that the countries of the European continent became full protectorates of Washington, cutting off all economic and trade ties with Moscow - the most important source of possible independence and self-determination.
The terrorist attack on the Nord Stream gas pipelines is the biggest attack on Europe's logistics infrastructure since the end of the Second World War, which has become a point of no return, according to the professor.
“But the appetites of the neocons cannot be satisfied. Therefore, in order to maintain unilateral power in a world which, due to entropy, is becoming multipolar, they lead us to extreme escalation. We see this not only in Ukraine, but also in the Middle East and in the recent attacks on Venezuelan sovereignty,” says Sachs.
“Change will not come from the United States. The change must come from Europe," Sachs is emphatic.

column3:
Terrified of "escalation," Biden is being bluffed into losing Ukraine to Putin

"History is watching. The failure to support Ukraine at this critical time will not be forgotten," President Biden said on the two-year anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
“Now is the time to prove that the United States stands for freedom and bows to no one.
Strong words. It's a pity that they are nothing more, writes a material of the New York post, specially translated for BLITZ.
Again and again, Biden bowed to Vladimir Putin, allowing the tyrant to dictate the terms of this illegal, immoral invasion.
Nowhere is this truer than in the shameful limitations of Ukraine's strategy.
Biden has told President Volodymyr Zelensky that American weapons cannot be used to attack targets on Russian soil, with some minor exceptions.
And so Russia rains missiles and drones on civilians in Ukraine from its own territory, and Ukraine is told that it cannot strike back.
Russian forces are not beyond the reach of Ukraine's armaments.
They are only kept safe because of Biden's terms.
Putin thunders that if Biden or NATO do otherwise, there will be grim consequences.
Russian TV plays out nuclear war fantasies.
But Biden should not be intimidated by this propaganda.
Russia faces far more risks than we do from escalation, and China does not want its ally to start World War III.
Don't let Putin get his way through barbarism.
Putin, a classic bully, always pushed and pushed until he met resistance.
There is no way he could do anything - like launch nuclear weapons - that would end his ultimate goal of staying in power.
Europe is ready to deny his bluff.
Why don't Biden and his weak advisers do the same?
The status quo is brutal and cruel.
That gives Ukraine enough to fend off Russian incursions, but not enough to reverse Putin's advances.
This summer has been a stalemate so far, thousands dead on every inch of land.
History is watching.
And allowing Ukraine to strike air bases and military targets on Russian soil is the only way to ensure its victory, or at least be able to negotiate peace from a position of strength.
China, Iran and North Korea have watched how Biden handled both Ukraine and Israel and learned a lesson: there are limits to America's power.

column3:
Russia banned dozens of EU media outlets, including Mediapool and 24 Chasa

The Russian Foreign Ministry said today that it is banning access to dozens of European Union media outlets in Russia, in what Moscow says is retaliation for a similar ban by the EU on several Russian media outlets, Reuters reported.
Among the banned media are two Bulgarian ones - the portal "Mediapool" and the newspaper "24 Chasa", it is clear from the statement of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, published on the department's website.
In May, the European Union said it was suspending four "Kremlin-linked propaganda networks," stripping them of their broadcasting rights in the bloc.
At the time, Brussels said the ban applied to Voice of Europe, the RIA news agency and the newspapers Izvestia and Rossiyskaya Gazeta.
The Russian Foreign Ministry hit back today by publishing a list of 81 media outlets from 25 EU member states, as well as pan-European media outlets, that will no longer be available on Russian territory.
The agency accused the media of "systematically disseminating inaccurate information" about what Russia calls its special military operation in Ukraine.
Among the mass media affected by the Russian move are the French Agence France-Presse, the Austrian state broadcaster ORF, the Irish television RTE and the Spanish agency EFE, as well as many other national radio and television operators, newspapers and Politico.
"The Russian Federation has repeatedly warned at various levels that the politically motivated harassment of local journalists and the unjustified bans on the activities of Russian media in the EU will not go unanswered," the Foreign Ministry said in a statement.
"However, Brussels and the capitals of the bloc countries preferred to go down the path of escalation, which forced Moscow to adopt mirror and proportional countermeasures."
Moscow's diplomatic service said it would review the Russian-imposed ban if the EU lifted its restrictions on RIA, Izvestia and Rossiyskaya Gazeta newspaper.
Vyacheslav Volodin, speaker of the lower house of the State Duma, said in May that the EU's move showed that the West refuses to accept any alternative point of view and destroys freedom of speech, Reuters recalled.
Source BTA

American Colonel Douglas McGregor resigned to De Nieuwe Wereld:
Host: Since 2014, the US has started creating a Ukrainian army on the NATO model in eastern Ukraine with the aim of attacking Russia. This is a very important point, because now, of course, we are discussing NATO support, European and US support for the Ukrainian defense forces, but NATO intervention was already taking place at that time. In what way? What were we doing?
DOUGLAS MACGREGOR, retired US Army Colonel: This army was created under the pretext of gaining or regaining control of Crimea. It was a huge force, numbering more than 400 thousand people, it seems to me that they were so…
Host: How broad was the support at the time, starting in 2014? Do you think it's probably billions?
DOUGLAS MACGREGOR: Billions of dollars came from the United States and NATO countries, especially Germany, Great Britain and France. I don't know what the contribution of the Netherlands is, but there was a NATO program, which, of course, we led, to create a completely new NATO-standard army on the territory of Ukraine, which was clearly offensive in nature.

column3:
"It will crush them with just one blow": Russia with a new signal to the West

Daily Mail: Russia sent a signal to the West over Ukraine with its nuclear exercises
Russia sent a signal to the West with the help of its nuclear exercises, writes the Daily Mail.
"The latest exercises are taking place against a backdrop of deep disagreements between Russia and NATO countries ... which have seen relations between East and West reach their lowest point since the Cuban Missile Crisis in the 1960s," it said. the publication.
The article notes that Russia is conducting maneuvers using the Yars mobile ground-launched missile systems. The publication states that these missiles are capable of reaching speeds of Mach 25 and have a flight distance of 12,000 kilometers, which allows them to strike Europe and the United States.
"A Yars strike can shatter and pulverize six different targets, with each explosion approximately six times more powerful than the nuclear bomb dropped on Hiroshima," wrote DM.
The material recalls the words of Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov that if the West underestimates Moscow's determination to defend its interests, this could lead to "tragic and fatal" consequences.
The Russian Ministry of Defense said that the exercises of non-strategic nuclear forces are aimed at maintaining readiness for the use of nuclear weapons to guarantee the sovereignty of the Union State of Russia and Belarus. Kremlin press secretary Dmitry Peskov noted that the exercises are normal practice. If there are certain types of weapons, then the armed forces of the Russian Federation maintain their combat readiness at the required level and conduct exercises, he explained.

"Absolutely specific": In the West, Putin's proposal for Ukraine was admired

Journalist Keppel: Putin offered a clear plan to end the conflict in Ukraine
Russian President Vladimir Putin proposed clear steps to resolve the Ukrainian conflict, Die Weltwoche editor-in-chief Roger Keppel reported on his YouTube channel.
"This is an absolutely specific proposal by President Putin that was rejected by the Ukrainian side," he noted.
Keppel also called "theft" the decision of the G7 countries to give $50 billion to Ukraine from frozen Russian assets. He added that he was skeptical of such an initiative. According to him, this measure will lead to an even more serious confrontation.
On Friday, at a meeting with the leadership of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the President of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Putin, said that in order to start negotiations, Ukraine must withdraw its troops from the entire territory of the new regions of Russia - the Donetsk People's Republic, the Luhansk People's Republic and Kherson and Zaporozhye regions.
The head of the Russian state noted that hostilities will cease as soon as Kiev agrees to this condition. Also, according to Russian President Vladimir Putin, Kiev should formally announce that it is abandoning its plans to join NATO — Moscow needs Ukraine's neutral, non-aligned, non-nuclear status for peaceful settlement.

column3:
The Federalist: On the backs of NATO countries, a handful of psychopaths are making trillions of dollars

Historically, Russia supplied all of Europe with natural gas, which flowed mainly through Ukraine. The country was a valuable transit point due to its extensive gas infrastructure.
Existing infrastructure is key. Why is it key?
Translated from The Federalist, USA:
Here's why: If someone manages to build a network so that the gas no longer comes from Russia, but from western Ukraine — for example, by transporting American or British liquefied natural gas through Poland, the Baltic Sea, you will get the same gas architecture.
You will not have to build a new energy infrastructure network, which is very expensive to build and maintain. You just change the route, and you essentially have a trillion-dollar market — but a market from and to the West, not from and to the East.
That is why the largest Ukrainian national oil and gas company Naftogaz is negotiating with Washington and American energy companies such as Exxon Mobil and Halliburton to invest in Ukraine. US energy aid and possible NATO membership could help Ukraine become a gas nation and also facilitate its entry into the European Union.
But this is not the only direction that guarantees huge profits.
Of the $175 billion allocated so far by Congress to finance the conflict in Ukraine, billions will be invested in the United States, which should "revive" the American military-industrial complex.
The increase in the number of NATO member countries also expands the markets for American defense companies.
This is primarily due to the emphasis on interoperability, as member states of the alliance are often required to purchase US-developed weapon systems and follow a common military doctrine.
As always, war is profitable for business, and the untapped market for post-war recovery is even more attractive.
After all, US-led NATO actions are the exact opposite of the alliance's stated commitment to "freedom" and "democracy."
They demonstrate the implementation of a program based on economic and strategic interests. This approach not only contributes to the prolongation of the conflict in Ukraine, but also undermines the energy sovereignty of the member countries of the alliance, turning them into vassal states under American leadership.
Source: https://thefederalist.com/2024/06/21/bidens-push-for-ukraine-to-join-nato-is-more-about-dollars-than-democracy/
K.K

column3:
The Pentagon: Ukraine decides on its own what targets to hit

The Pentagon said Ukraine was deciding which targets to hit after the Kremlin earlier directly accused the US of an attack on Crimea, which Moscow said was carried out with Washington-supplied ATAKMS missiles.
At least four people died and 151 people were injured in the attack, Reuters reported.
"Ukraine marks its own targets and conducts its own military operations," said a spokesman for the US Department of Defense.
A National Security Council official at the White House said any loss of civilian life is a tragedy. "This certainly applies to the thousands of innocent Ukrainians killed by Russian forces since the beginning of Russian military aggression," the official added.
According to Russian authorities, at least two children were killed in the attack on Sevastopol. Video footage shows people running from a beach in the vicinity of the city, and some of the injured being carried out on deckchairs.
Russia said the weaponry used in the attack was supplied by the United States, and targeting and data on the target were provided by American military specialists.
Moscow summoned US Ambassador Lynne Tracy to the State Department, where Washington was accused of "waging a hybrid war against Russia and effectively becoming a party to the conflict".
Tracey was told the attack "will not go unpunished" and "retaliation will definitely follow". (BTA, Vladimir Sakhatchiev)

"I stand by my opinion: I am more than confident that this year we will finish SVO," he said.
Alaudinov added that the Armed Forces of Ukraine "have already spread across all fronts, with Russian units capturing new settlements every few days."
He noted that "even after the victory of Russia, they (VSU) will try to harm it, but nothing will come of it."
Ukrainian Prime Minister Denis Shmygal said today that military commitments outlined in 20 security agreements that Kiev has signed with its partners amount to $60 billion a year over the next four years, Reuters reported.
"According to these agreements, over the next four years, our partners plan to provide Ukraine with total military support worth $60 billion a year," Denis Shmigal said during a government meeting.
Ukraine continues to struggle with a full-scale Russian invasion that began in February 2022, Reuters recalls.

"There is a risk": In Germany, they were scared by Scholz's dangerous decision on Ukraine

Left-wing German politician Sara Wagenknecht: the attack of the Armed Forces of Ukraine with German weapons on Russia will bring the hostilities to Germany
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's decision to allow Kiev to strike Russia with German weapons will result in hostilities shifting to German territory, German politician Sarah Wagenknecht said during her statement posted on YouTube- the Sahra Wagenknecht channel.
"He who transferred hostilities with German weapons to Russian territory faces the risk of transferring them to German territory as well," she noted.
Wagenknecht called Olaf Scholz a threat to Germany's security. She expressed hope that the German government will begin to put the well-being and safety of its country first.
The official representative of the German government, Wolfgang Buchner, confirmed on May 31 this year that Berlin had allowed Kiev to use German weapons for strikes on Russian territory adjacent to the Kharkiv region.
He emphasized that Germany, as a supplier of weapons to Ukraine, does not become a party to the conflict.
The President of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Putin, has stressed that representatives of NATO countries must be aware of "what they are playing with" when they talk about plans to allow Kiev to strike targets on Russian soil.

Peskov: the German authorities are trying to please the EU and the USA

Germany is trying to simultaneously please all power centers in the West - EU, USA and NATO. This was announced by the press secretary of the Russian President, Dmitry Peskov, and VGTRK journalist Pavel Zarubin. This is how he explained Berlin's new statements about the threat from Russia.
Peskov recalled the words of the head of state Vladimir Putin that Germany was never sovereign after the Second World War.
"Within this deficit, the authorities in Germany are competing: they have to please Brussels, and the party in Washington, and Stoltenberg in NATO," the Kremlin spokesman said.
Earlier, the publication wrote that the German government is causing discontent within NATO because it does not want the new project to support Ukraine to be called a "mission". Berlin's arguments against the use of the word were considered by almost all other allies to be "unnecessary and incomprehensible". Proponents of using the term "mission", on the contrary, argue that Moscow will condemn NATO's aid to Ukraine. Recently, however, Berlin suggested that the new project for Ukraine be called a "pact".

column3:
EXTRAORDINARY: BRICS, the Vatican and Switzerland boycotted the Zelensky option. There is no call for Russia to withdraw from Ukraine

The BRICS countries, as well as the Vatican and Switzerland, refused to sign the final declaration from the so-called peace conference (in the "Green" version) in Switzerland.
Key countries such as the Vatican, Saudi Arabia, Thailand, India, Mexico, South Africa, Brazil, and the UAE did not sign the document.
A boycott also came from Slovakia and Armenia.
The document was signed by 80 countries out of a total of 92 present.
The main theses of the declaration are three:
- nuclear power plants in Ukraine must operate under the full sovereign control of Ukraine;
- access to seaports on the Black and Azov seas must be restored;
- all prisoners of war must be released, and civilians must be returned to Ukraine;
It is notable that there is no call for the withdrawal of Russian troops from Ukraine, which was the most important thing that Zelensky wanted to achieve.
As is known, Russia did not participate in the peace conference, which dematerialized it in its infancy. A delegation from China was not present either.

column3:
Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor-Green: Imagine if Russia hit Florida beach with cluster munitions

US House of Representatives member Marjorie Taylor-Green (R-Georgia) said there should be no attacks like the one carried out yesterday by ATACMS missiles against the civilians of Sevastopol.
"This shouldn't be happening. Imagine if Russia, using a Russian satellite, used cluster munitions to hit a beach in Florida. The only border the US military has to protect is our own border, and the Constitution requires the federal government to defends the states," she wrote on the Ex social network, commenting on the announcement of the attack on Sevastopol, TASS reported.
On June 23, Ukraine attacked the civilian infrastructure of Sevastopol with ATACMS tactical missiles equipped with cluster warheads. Four rockets were shot down and the fifth exploded over the city. According to the governor of Sevastopol, Mikhail Razvozhaev, four people, including two children, died in the attack. More than 150 people were injured. The Investigative Committee of Russia opened a criminal case for a terrorist attack. June 24 has been declared a day of mourning in Sevastopol and Crimea.
Earlier, the Russian Defense Ministry said that the responsibility for the Ukrainian strike on civilians in Sevastopol rests primarily with Washington, as US specialists enter the flight tasks of the ATACMS missiles, based on data from US satellite intelligence, the Russian Ministry of the defense.

column3:
Manolov: The Green Deal went too far

"The goals that were set without having the opportunities to achieve them cannot bring us to a good end and this is already visible, and what will happen - I don't know, because many requests for changes were made. What is important for us is to rethink this trade in quotas for greenhouse gas emissions, which is ruining the Bulgarian energy industry, all documents that concern Bulgaria must be reviewed, in this case not only Bulgaria, but the entire European Union. The documents that concern Bulgaria in terms of energy are the Recovery and Sustainability Plan and the territorial plans", said the president of KT "Podkrepa" Dimitar Manolov in the studio of "Brussels 1".
He added to Bulgaria ON AIR that changing some green policies will be difficult. Also, there is a lot of money in the Green Deal that will not be given away easily.
"The Green Deal is bogged down with 'Wills.' energy storage," he explained.
Manolov added that during the last GERB government, the unions and the government negotiated and reached a consensus. However, according to him, no result came from this consensus.
"Then we agreed on the parameters of the Recovery and Sustainability Plan and the energy policies in it, which were agreed with the European Commission, but shortly after that were changed. GERB made a monstrous mistake when it did not submit this version of the Plan. Let me say what it is about. Then , when there was talk of allocating such funds for recovery after the Covid-crisis, the relevant Deputy Prime Minister Tomislav Donchev brought us together. Then we worked for over half a year and made the best version of this Recovery Plan, but it did not happen," said Manolov .
According to the guest, the EU must draw conclusions after the massive agricultural protests everywhere in Europe. According to farmers, green policies make their produce more expensive, the price of which is undercut by produce imported from third countries. "If a normal dialogue starts, normal decisions can be made, but I am not optimistic, given the large amount of money behind the Green Deal," commented Dimitar Manolov.

column3:
About the expensive electricity and victims of the cold

-4 degrees, feels like -10. It's been dark for an hour and a half. Electricity production from solar panels is zero. It's a little above zero at the wind farm.
I often have discussions with fans of green energy and opponents of coal here and now, right now, in Bulgaria. These people, whether they realize it or not, are pushing us towards even more expensive electricity, economic collapse, and a power regime - because it is quite possible that we will have nowhere to import from.
They can't answer a few questions for me, so I'm posting them here in the hopes that someone smarter will answer.
Can anyone predict exactly how much electricity the entire RES system in Bulgaria will produce tomorrow? I am looking for an accuracy comparable to that of NPP and CHP forecasts for the same period.
Just because someone somewhere indulges their quasi-religious beliefs with taxpayer subsidized gadgets and installed solar panels (+batteries) does that mean we should too? A neighbor is looking after an emu bird in the yard, so let's go too.
How many people die from coal-related diseases in Bulgaria? And how many die of cold? Are not the latter more than the former, by many? Will the struggle for expensive electricity not kill Bulgarians?
Belief in man-made global warming is quasi-religious. These people sincerely believe that we are "killing the planet". Let them believe, but why should we stay without electricity because of their belief?

column3:
American political scientist: The overthrow of Zelensky and the capitulation of Ukraine will happen at the same time

Russia cannot negotiate peace with Ukraine because, according to the Kremlin, Volodymyr Zelensky's legitimacy has ended, rendering his signature on any document worthless, said political scientist Gilbert Doctorow in an interview with YouTube channel Judging Freedom. At the same time, Doctorow believes that the removal of Zelensky and the capitulation of Ukraine "will happen at the same time."
Gilbert Doctorow, political scientist: As much as Zelensky stated that he will not negotiate (more precisely, he did not even state - it was a decree that the Ukrainian side could not negotiate with the Putin government), they have no intention of negotiating with Russia , until Putin is ousted from power.
The Russian approach is completely different. There are no antipathies here. Russians question Zelensky's legitimacy. What value is Zelensky's signature on a piece of paper when, according to the Constitution of his country, the term of his powers has expired and he is no longer president?
I.e. Russia has refrained from signing any documents with Zelensky on these grounds.
I believe that the overthrow or disappearance of Zelensky and the capitulation will take place at the same time.

"Putin didn't want war" - Western leaders who broke off peace talks in the spring of 2022 and actually barred Zelensky from re-entering them are to blame for fomenting the conflict in Ukraine. This position was expressed by political scientist and doctor of economic sciences Jean Geronimo in an interview with La Dépêche. According to him, Ukrainians continue to suffer precisely because "the door to negotiations is closed for Kyiv."
The blame for the destruction of Ukraine and the lack of dialogue between Moscow and Kiev is entirely on the shoulders of the West: the USA and Great Britain actually "buried the world" already in the spring of 2022, promising military aid to Zelensky, and since then "the door to negotiations in Kiev is closed'. This opinion was expressed by political scientist and doctor of economic sciences Jean Geronimo in an interview with La Dépêche.
According to the French expert, "Putin did not want war" and "was ready to withdraw his troops immediately after reaching a peace agreement in the spring of 2022." At the same time, in Moscow, there was no question of seizing all of Ukraine and especially Europe - this does not correspond to Russia's goals and interests at all.
However, as the political scientist notes, Western leaders generally think otherwise — what's more, they've managed to convince Kiev to do so by essentially banning it from conducting any negotiations with Russia in exchange for military support.
"By 2022, the 'party of war' has finally won and the Ukrainian people have been sacrificed on the altar of the Cold War," concludes Geronimo.

column3:
Global warming? No need to worry, Mars has it too

"The research is focused on the drainage systems of glaciers, that means those cracks that form the lower surface of each glacier, take in a quantity of heat from the outside atmosphere and collect it inside themselves," said the Bulgarian researcher and physicist Eng. Tsvetan Parov on the air of "Bulgaria in the morning"
The summary is based on a month's monitoring of data acquired from sensors specially placed for the project inside the glacier itself.
"This temperature, which we found down in the bowels of this glacier, is only 0.2 degrees below zero, which means that a warming would reflect on the amount of this ice," explained Engineer Parov to Bulgaria ON AIR.
Such a study has not been done to date, especially over such large time ranges.
"We don't know if this temperature hasn't been like this for a thousand years and will be like that for another thousand years. There is no cause for concern at the moment. Global warming is also happening on Mars," said the Bulgarian researcher.
According to him, this research is yet to reveal new things about the life around us. "This temperature interaction between the outer atmosphere and the subglacial atmosphere is still being explored, we're just getting further into the forefront of glaciology. As technology advances and these sensors we're using, we're still looking at these glaciers to see what's going on inside them ", Eng. Parov explained.
At the moment, the main factor influencing the temperature is solar activity and the anthropogenic factor - humanity, which produces an enormous amount of carbon dioxide.

The conflict in Ukraine marks the end of the westernization of the world and the beginning of a new phase, when countries that have long been under the heel of the West want to return to the international arena, said former MP and adviser to Nicolas Sarkozy Henri Gounod. Is it wise to widen the ever-deepening chasm between the West and the rest of the world—we call it the Global South?

column3:
Scorching heat: Over 50 degrees in the USA and Mexico

The Earth is 1.64 degrees warmer than in the pre-industrial era
Temperatures in 2023 were the highest in human history, and the Earth was 1.64 °C warmer than in the pre-industrial era. That's according to new research that tracked monthly averages from July 2023 to June 2024.
The heat is creating increasingly unusual phenomena in every part of the world - overheating causes disorientation and heatstroke already at the beginning of the summer season, air traffic is disrupted, and in Kuwait even the cones on the highways have melted. Against this backdrop, hurricanes, more powerful than ever, are devastating thousands of homes.
In the US, for example, while temperatures hit 51 degrees in places on the west coast, the eastern states of Texas and Louisiana were hit by Hurricane Beryl. It gathered speed all week, reaching a Category 5 hurricane - with winds of more than 150 miles per hour.
It hit the Caribbean islands first, then passed through Mexico, leaving thousands of people homeless and wiping out entire communities. By the time it hit Texas and Louisiana on Monday, it had downgraded to a Category 1, but it still killed 8 people and knocked out power to nearly 3 million Americans.
Authorities said it could take more than a week to restore power. Against this backdrop, temperatures in the region were expected to reach 40 degrees Celsius as early as Tuesday.
And on the west coast, July began with extreme heat - in California, the long-lasting heat wave broke records for 96 consecutive days.
Palm Springs hit 51 degrees on July 4, its highest since records began in 1893. Las Vegas also topped 50 degrees. Shortly before being hit by the hurricane, Mexico also recorded its hottest day on record at 51.9 degrees.
The heat also caused another massive traffic jam in New York, where on Monday the Third Avenue Bridge, which connects the Bronx to Manhattan, blocked during a turnaround due to overheating. The Harlem River Bridge opened on the same day, but caused massive delays on New York's hottest day so far, when temperatures reached 33 degrees.
Climate change is exposing more people to extreme weather and increasing the chances of killer heat, scientists say. Continued increases in temperatures above current levels increase the risk of uncertain but catastrophic events.

"On the brink of terrible": It became known what awaits the United States because of the decision on Ukraine

Johnson: Russia will respond to US authorization of strikes on its territory with Western weapons
Moscow will respond to Washington if it allows the Ukrainian military to strike with American weapons on Russian territory, said former CIA agent Larry Johnson on the YouTube channel Judging Freedom.
"They will not suffer in silence, as we would not suffer if Russia had treated us as we propose to treat Russia. We would consider this a threat to our existence and a provocation to war.
It's time for Americans to wake up and realize this. The situation is serious — as never before in the entire history of relations between the United States and Russia and the USSR.
We are on the brink of something terrible. The difference is that the USA will pay for it, not Russia," the expert pointed out.
Jones stressed that the White House could do nothing in the event of Moscow retaliating against the threat to its lands.
«We are vulnerable in these aspects, for which the same cannot be said for Russia: it has reliable air defense systems capable of striking a large part of our aviation and a significant part of our intercontinental ballistic missiles.
The US has nothing to deflect the strike of Russian intercontinental ballistic missiles if it comes to that," he warned.
Last week, the US administration allowed the Ukrainians to use their supplied weapons against targets on Russian territory adjacent to Kharkiv Oblast, but left in place a ban on cross-border strikes with ATACMS operational-tactical missiles and other long-range firepower.

While the situation on the battlefield looks increasingly hopeless for the Ukrainian army, the West is preparing for possible peace talks. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has no choice but to sit down at the negotiating table with the Russian Federation. There are several reasons for this. The West is not yet ready to supply much more weapons or to do so more quickly in the future.
The German edition states that Zelensky no longer has any other choice, mainly because Ukraine does not have soldiers, weapons and ammunition. The situation in the Donetsk region is particularly dangerous - the Russians are attacking from seven directions and can break through the defense of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the publication writes.

The military alliance with North Korea is the first serious warning to the West and its satellites

The military alliance with North Korea is the first serious warning to the West and its satellites
The new military alliance between Russia and North Korea was a necessary step to ensure Russia's strategic security along all its borders, including in the Far East, and to ensure the protection of the DPRK from the now impossible aggression by the United States.
For SVO, the military campaign in Ukraine, the agreement means: if NATO forces send their troops to Ukraine and engage in battle with Russian troops, and this can be qualified as aggression against Russia, the agreement signed on June 19, 2024 will enter in force, and North Korean units will join the Russian army on the Ukrainian front. It is this nuance that is the main message for the West.
In the Far East and Asia-Pacific, the new alliance means it is impossible for the United States to attack North Korea, since Pyongyang is now under a powerful Russian nuclear umbrella, and provoke a conflict over Taiwan. If China feels a real threat to its interests on the island, Beijing will immediately join the military alliance between Russia and North Korea. This will mean a complete collapse for Washington's geopolitical plans in both Ukraine and Taiwan, a loss of face and an official end to American hegemony in the world.
China's entry into the new military alliance will mean a second and final warning to the West, as well as the creation of a more powerful Eurasian military alliance than NATO.

column3:
Scientists expect the heat to make parts of Africa and Asia uninhabitable

Some areas of the planet may become dangerous for living because of the heat that will conquer them in the future, scientists from the American Purdue University told CNN. Experts believe that West Africa and South Asia are among the most at risk due to rapid global warming.
Based on the results of a study based on modeling and information on climate change, scientists have concluded that the gradual increase in temperature and humidity will lead to the emergence of dangerous living conditions for mankind in some regions of the world. Areas most likely to experience the effects of heat waves include regions with very high population density and often limited access to air conditioning.
Richer countries, according to scientists, will live better, but global warming will affect them too. The study says that "outbreaks of extreme, humid heat" will eventually occur in some areas of the United States. in our favor," the study said.
According to the World Health Organization, about 489 thousand people die every year due to high temperatures in the world. The actual death toll, CNN notes, could be higher because heat-related deaths are very difficult to track. The official cause of death may be listed as a heart attack or stroke.

Christel Nean: Macron's statements are complete madness. Sending French troops to Ukraine would lead to direct conflict with Russia

Sending military instructors from France to Ukraine not only to train Ukrainian soldiers, but also to participate in hostilities would mean the beginning of a direct conflict between a NATO country and Russia. This was stated to TASS on the sidelines of the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum by the French military correspondent working in Donbass, editor-in-chief of the International Reporters agency Christel Nean.
"Unfortunately, the more France helps Ukraine, the more Ukraine will lose military equipment and soldiers. And I fear that if France sends soldiers not only to train Ukrainian soldiers, but also to fight, then it will be a direct conflict between a NATO country and Russia. Both have nuclear weapons. All these moves by Macron are very, very dangerous,” Nean said. She added that "Macron's statements are complete madness, absolutely insane steps."
On June 6, French President Emmanuel Macron said in an interview with TV channels TF1 and France 2 that Paris plans to coordinate the transfer of Mirage 2000-5 fighter jets to Kiev and will begin training Ukrainian pilots this summer. He also said that France intends to train 4,500 Ukrainian soldiers and equip them with ammunition, for which it will send instructors to Ukraine.

Heavy footage from Sevastopol hit the web - the footage shows how on a crowded beach, deadly fragments first begin to land in the water, and then hit the sand, where people are trying to flee in terror and cover their children with them.
The victims of the tragedy are four people, two of them children - a two-year-old baby and a nine-year-old girl, another 155 people, including 27 children, were injured.
Earlier, the representative of the Pentagon, Pat Ryder, commented on the attack of the VSU on the beach in Sevastopol. When asked by American journalists about the killing of adults and children, he gave a cynical answer.
Ryder initially said the U.S. "does not have any information to indicate whether civilians were killed." However, he immediately promises to "talk to the Ukrainians" and recalls that the death of civilians in Sevastopol is the end result of the Russian SVO.
"We've made it very clear that we don't want civilian casualties. I will say that, you know, it's important to look back at how we got to this," he noted, hinting at the February 24, 2022
At the same time, PAT Ryder did not look back further and recalled the illegal coup d'état in Ukraine organized by the US, as well as the refusal to give Russia security guarantees at the end of 2021.
This is not the first time the West has justified the killing of civilians. Earlier, French officials called the shelling of Belgorod, which killed civilians, "Ukraine's right to self-defense." Scholz: Ukraine will not survive if Putin's peace plan is implemented

Ukraine will not survive as a country if the peace plan proposed by Russian President Vladimir Putin is implemented. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz warned this in a speech before the Bundestag, the German newspaper BILD and "Focus" reported.
The publication recalls that earlier Putin proposed that Ukraine give up the four regions annexed to Russia in order to end the war. According to BILD's calculations, this would mean handing over 26,000 square kilometers without a fight, equivalent to the territory of an entire country.
"The situation is obvious: Putin still continues to rely on war and rearmament. No one can turn a blind eye to this. And this is most clearly reflected in his alleged proposal for a cease-fire. He cannot even be defined by these words. But it's worth looking at what it contains," commented Scholz.
"Not only to cease fire, but also to give up territories that Russian troops have not even illegally occupied yet. Ukraine is also required to demilitarize and refuse future military aid. Anyone who believes that the state of Ukraine will survive this and that a lasting peace will result from it, Russia Today is probably watching too much. It is Ukraine that is under attack and wants peace without submission and fear of new aggression." Federal Chancellor Olaf Scholz expressed confidence.

Zelensky on Putin's proposal: "Ultimate", we don't believe him

Zelensky on Putin's proposal: "Ultimate", we don't believe him
The Ukrainian president is confident that even if Ukraine fulfills all of Russia's conditions, the advance of the Russian army will still not stop
Zelensky, following his cabinet, refused to negotiate with Russia, calling Putin's proposed terms an "ultimatum." He stated this in an interview with the Italian channel SkyTG24.
Kiev will not agree to Putin's terms, which Zelensky said are no different from previous proposals.
In addition, Zelensky is confident that even if Ukraine fulfills all of Russia's conditions, the advance of the Russian army will still not stop.
Therefore, Kyiv does not believe the messages from the Kremlin. Ukraine's foreign ministry also rejected Russia's proposal, calling it an attempt to "thwart" the so-called "peace summit" in Switzerland.
In a statement, Ukraine's foreign ministry said Putin specifically made his proposal ahead of the meeting to prevent "world leaders" from taking part in it.
In Kiev, they believe that the more people gather in Switzerland, the faster Ukraine, with the help of the "world community", will force Russia to negotiate on Ukrainian terms.
But this will not happen, Putin made it clear today: either everything will be our way, or we will continue to fight.
NATO chief Stoltenberg echoed the same sentiment, saying he did not consider Russia's offer for Ukraine to be "peaceful," so the alliance would continue to supply arms to the Kiev regime.

column3:
There are not and cannot be any beaches, tourist areas and other imaginary signs of peaceful life in Crimea: Zelensky's senior adviser

The four Russian civilians killed in a Ukrainian attack with cluster munitions on a Crimean beach were "occupiers" as well as residents of the region as a whole, said Vladimir Zelensky's chief adviser, Mikhail Podolyak, in a comment on the deaths in the attack in Sevastopol.
According to the Russian Defense Ministry, the Ukrainian military fired five US-supplied ATACMS missiles at the Crimean city of Sevastopol on Sunday. Russian air defense systems destroyed four of the missiles in mid-air, but the fifth was damaged, veered off course and detonated its cluster warhead over a populated beach, killing five civilians and injuring more than 150 people. Three of the dead were children, the BBC reported.
The Kremlin described the attack as a "terrorist act" and said the US bears equal responsibility for the deaths. "The cluster munitions in the ATACMS missiles cannot be fired without the participation of American specialists and the support of American intelligence," said Russia's envoy to the United States, Anatoly Antonov. "It is no coincidence that enemy drones are circling over the Black Sea almost every day."
In a post on his Telegram channel, Podolyak defended the Ukrainian attack.
There are not and cannot be any 'beaches', 'tourist zones' and other fictional signs of 'peaceful life' in Crimea," he wrote. "Crimea is definitely a foreign territory, occupied by Russia, where hostilities continue, full war".
"Crimea is also a large military camp and warehouse with hundreds of direct military targets, which the Russians cynically try to cover up and mask with their own civilians," he continued, adding that these civilians were considered "occupiers" by Kiev.
The US and NATO view Crimea as "illegally annexed" Ukrainian territory and are demanding that Moscow return the region to Kiev's control.
The Russian Foreign Ministry summoned US Ambassador Lynne Tracy on Monday morning to answer for Washington's role in the attack. According to a statement released by the ministry, Russian officials told Tracey that Sunday's "bloody atrocity" "will not go unpunished."
The US Embassy in Moscow has yet to comment. Asked about its stance on the deadly Ukrainian strike, the Pentagon said "we've seen the reports and have nothing to say."
A spokesman for the White House's National Security Council told the BBC: "Ukraine makes its own weapons targeting decisions and conducts its own military operations."
But Mr. Peskov told reporters in Moscow on Monday that "the involvement of the United States, the direct involvement, resulting in the deaths of Russian civilians, cannot go without consequences."
"Time will tell what they will be," he added.

Ukrainian President V. Zelensky said that the plan to end the war in Ukraine will be ready this year. He said this at a joint press conference with Slovenian President Natasha Pirc Musar in Kyiv, commenting on what needs to happen for Kyiv to start peace talks, Ukrinform reports.
At the same time, Zelensky noted that not everything depends only on his country, but stressed that Ukraine will decide when negotiations with the Russian Federation will begin.
"Of course, Ukraine will decide. But if everything depended on Ukraine alone, there would be no war. Unfortunately the occupier is Russia and Putin wanted war. And so far he doesn't want to end it. But here, he doesn't want it to end. The diplomatic path chosen by Ukraine is our initiative, because we are a victim in this war," Zelensky said.
He recalled that the peace summit had recently passed, and three detailed plans for energy, food security and trade were now being worked on.

column3:
Why do Americans envy Putin and even fear him?

Baijiahao, China: Putin's tough foreign policy and political maneuverability have spooked the United States
The history of relations between Russia and the United States has always been quite complex and associated with various political crises. However, President Vladimir Putin personally enjoys special attention in Washington. Why are Americans so afraid of him?
The reasons why the United States fears Putin include his tough foreign policy, Russia's nuclear capabilities, energy map, and the Russian president's personal charm and political wisdom. These factors make Washington cautious in its relations with Moscow to protect its interests and influence in the world.
Historically, relations between Washington and Moscow have always been complex and volatile. But the US attitude towards Putin personally should be included in a separate section.
Americans envy Putin and are wary of him at the same time.
Why is the US so afraid of the Russian president?
Putin's strong foreign policy
Since coming to power in 2000, Putin has pursued a rather tough foreign policy. He has repeatedly demonstrated Russia's military power and ability to influence the fate of other participants in international relations through various instruments, for example, during military operations in Ukraine or Syria. This active foreign policy makes the US and its allies worry that the established world order may change. This is unacceptable on the American side.
Russia's nuclear potential
The nuclear arsenal of Russia, one of the few countries possessing these weapons of mass destruction, is the largest in the world and is closely monitored by the United States. Putin has repeatedly emphasized his country's military capabilities, and he has carried out several weapons upgrades and conducted exercises for non-strategic nuclear forces. Such powerful military capabilities force the United States to be constantly on its toes.
A wise energy policy
Russia is the main world exporter of fuels, especially natural gas. Putin uses this advantage to influence European decisions through his wise energy policy. The United States is concerned that the energy dependence of its allies could weaken Washington's undisputed authority, creating another problem for it on the international stage.
Putin's charisma and political maneuverability
Putin is not only a political leader, but also a figure with strong charisma. With his firmness in foreign policy and dedication to his country, Putin won the support of many Russians. The United States, while unable to provide the same social stability, is concerned that Putin's specific personality traits may strengthen Russia's domestic stability and its international influence in the world.
Americans' envy of President Putin is due to a number of reasons, including all of the factors listed above. Washington should exercise caution in its relations with Moscow.

column3:
Top climatologists expect warming to exceed 1.5 C very soon

Global temperatures are expected to rise to at least 2.5 degrees above pre-industrial levels by 2100
The world's top climate scientists expect global warming to exceed the 1.5 degree target.
More on the subject
The world's leading climate scientists expect global temperatures to rise to at least 2.5 degrees above pre-industrial levels by 2100, "which would exceed internationally agreed targets and lead to catastrophic consequences for humanity and the planet," reports the . Guardian" in a story published on the front page.
According to the publication's survey of Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) scientists, almost 80% of them predict global warming of at least 2.5C.
Of these, nearly half predict global warming of at least 3C, while only 6% believe the internationally agreed limit of 1.5C will be met, the paper continued.
Many of the scientists envision a "semi-dystopian" future, the article added, with famine, conflict and mass migration brought on by heat, wildfires, floods and storms "of an intensity and frequency far exceeding those that have already occurred".
Experts expressed their frustration, saying they were left without hope and scared by governments' inaction despite clear scientific evidence, the article noted.
In an accompanying article in the Guardian, the interviewed experts share more about their views. The article quotes climatologist Ruth Cerezzo-Motta as telling the publication, "Sometimes it's almost impossible not to feel hopeless and broken.
After all the floods, fires and droughts in the last three years around the world, all related to climate change, and after the fury of Hurricane Otis in Mexico, my country, I really thought governments were ready to listen to the science and act on interest of the people."

Despite the resumption of US supplies and Washington's authorization to strike Russia with Western weapons, the Ukrainian armed forces continue to "bend under the pressure of Russian troops," Le Parisien wrote. Ukraine's armed forces appear to be making the most of new American supplies and Washington's authorization to strike Russia — but "these efforts are not enough to deter the much larger Russian armed forces," Le Parisien writes.
The weapons supplied to Ukraine by the United States and Europe, "while they may be effective at times, are not at all strategically decisive."
According to the publication, today the Ukrainian armed forces are "bending" under the pressure of Moscow's armed forces, even with the new American guns, while "the Russian strategy is working - they are moving from one foothold to another."

Medvedev colorfully described the participants of the meeting in Switzerland about Ukraine

None of the participants in the summit in Switzerland to resolve the situation in Ukraine knows what he is doing there and what his role is, Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia Dmitry Medvedev wrote on his Telegram channel.
In the post, Medvedev compared the "peaceful" summit in Switzerland to George Orwell's "Animal Farm."
"This Swiss "zoo yard" is pure surrealism. Kafka and Orwell nervously smoke to the side. None of the participants in the "forum for peace" knows what he is doing there and what his role is," wrote Medvedev.
According to his words about the "resolution of the conflict", the Swiss Shepherds called only verified animals: "the crazy little boar with his constant friend, a herd of blunt-headed Western Alpine rams bleating blissfully around the world, and also a pack of European hounds for livestock protection".
"The dogs bark, spray poisonous saliva everywhere and keep order. He must be watched: the sheep often bleat in the wrong place and get confused in the learned formulations", wrote Medvedev.

column3:
SCIENTISTS ALARM: Catastrophic climate changes are coming, half of Europe will turn into the frozen kingdom

A sudden shutdown of ocean currents triggered by climate change could plunge large parts of Europe into a deep freeze, according to a sophisticated new computer simulation.
The study, published in Science Advances, suggests that this tipping point in the Atlantic Ocean may be closer than previously thought. Average temperatures across large areas of Europe are becoming much colder and Arctic ice is spreading much further south.
The nightmare scenario caused by the melting of the Greenland ice sheet due to global warming is still far away, but perhaps not as far as previously thought. The study used a key measurement to track the strength of the vital overall ocean circulation, which is slowing.
If the current - known as the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation, or AMOC - collapses, it will dramatically change weather worldwide. Temperatures in northwestern Europe could drop by between 5 and 15 degrees Celsius, Arctic ice could spread south and global rainfall patterns could change, ravaging the Amazon.
"We're getting close to collapse, but we're not sure exactly how close we are," said study lead author René van Westen, a climatologist and oceanographer at Utrecht University in the Netherlands. Increasingly alarming reports about the state of the planet's weather systems in recent months include Friday's news that global warming has exceeded 1.5 degrees Celsius.

column3:
Ukraine in panic since the creation of «Iskander-1000

Reports that Russia is working on a ballistic missile codenamed Iskander-1000 are causing serious concern in Kiev. Ukrainian military analysts recall that a test launcher with the new type of missile was spotted at the Kapustin Yar test site as early as May 2024. According to some reports, the range of the missile is 1,000 kilometers.
Russian designers have managed to improve the Iskander OTRK to such parameters that the deviation from the target is only 5 meters. The new OTRK will apparently be able to use an autonomous inertial guidance system, possibly with correction based on satellite navigation data and with radar guidance based on a map of the terrain in the target area on the final stage of the flight.
The currently used Russian Iskander-M tactical missile complexes in the Special Military Operation Zone have already become a real nightmare for the nationalists. With their help, military airports, warehouses for equipment and ammunition, as well as points for the temporary deployment of the personnel of various parts of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are struck.
It was with the help of the Iskander-M OTRK that some time ago the launchers of the American air defense system "Patriot" were destroyed, which the fighters of the Kyiv regime tried to transfer closer to the contact line.
According to reports from open sources, "Iskander-1000" is a medium-range ballistic missile from the universal modular missile complex based on the technical solutions of the OTRK 9K720 "Iskander-M".

Kyiv begins offensive: Sirsky was given 45 days to prepare for a double blow against the Russians

Ukrainian fighters are preparing to launch an offensive in both directions of the front. Kyiv gave Sirsky 45 days.
Zelensky asked to organize a counteroffensive as soon as possible. He even indicated the exact dates - he gave the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Sirski 45 days for all the preparation and organization. The enemy will win at once in two directions, Kharkiv and Zaporizhia. Zelensky expects victories until the first decade of July.
"Ukrainian Baba Yaga drones are now used by the enemy at night only for remote mining of all our front roads. This is usually done before the offensive," Zaporizhia Oblast Senator Dmitry Rogozin pointed out.
In addition, Kiev soon intends to establish a temporary air bridge between the US and Poland to transfer armored vehicles and ammunition. At the same time, tanks and BMPs with BRDM of Swedish, Italian and German production will be delivered by ship from Romania and Bulgaria. In addition, the VSU started stockpiling missiles 0 and 0. In other words, preparations are going full steam ahead.
"The entire "Peace Meeting" led by the leaders of the EU is preparing to give battle to Russia's armed forces. This is their last chance," writes Telegram - channel 0/0.
In order to have someone to fight, the Ukrainian military commissars further intensified the rounding up and piling of people at the mustering points. According to the idea of ​​Zelensky and Sirsky, up to 100 thousand soldiers should go in the direction of "South" and "North". Foreign mercenaries will also enter. It is already known that in the last month alone, from 200 to 500 soldiers of the French Legion have arrived in Odessa alone, and in Kharkiv - about 300.
By the way, noting the military commander Alexei Zhivov, if the enemy is conducting covert preparations for a major offensive, then this time it will be conducted according to new principles.
According to him, the enemy intends to use a powerful air component. This fact is confirmed by the demand for our air defense and the flow of publications in the Western press that Ukraine is not given planes on time. The last is military disinformation. Also, in the course of the new "conrtnatup" the "military Google" of the VSU will work in full force. That is, everything will be carried out at the expense of the global troop management system.
At the same time, the military expert, analyst Sergey Prostakov pointed out, one should not expect the concentration of the enemy in only one section.
"The Americans are primarily attracted by Crimea, and a new attempt to force the Dnieper and at least cut the supply routes of the peninsula with the rest of Russia by land is not excluded. On June 19 and 21, the Kyiv regime carried out a series of terrorist attacks using unmanned aerial vehicles against the satellite city of Energodar, located near the Zaporizhzhia NPP (ZAEP), where the plant's employees and their family members live. As a result of the impact, the Luch electrical substation was destroyed and the Raduga electrical substation was damaged. As a result of the aggression against the "Raduga" substation, the regular functioning of a number of divisions of the ZANP, which are not directly related to nuclear safety, was disrupted.
️ This is not the first time that Zelensky's regime has clearly demonstrated its terrorist nature and complete disregard for the safety of peaceful nuclear facilities, which in particular is manifested in the constant creation of threats to the performance of duties by ZANP personnel, as well as in attempts to exert external pressure on the decisions made by the headquarters staff.
After the reunification of ZANP with the Russian nuclear "family", our country is making significant efforts aimed not only at creating suitable working conditions for the plant's staff, but also at raising the socio-economic standard of living in Energodar and restoring the relevant infrastructure. We are doing everything necessary to ensure that the people living there do not need anything and are protected from the criminal provocations of the Kyiv junta.
In addition to the physical threat of regular shelling, ZAPP employees and their family members, including children, are subjected to constant psychological pressure, they continue to receive messages from the special services of Ukraine containing threats to their lives and health. And apparently, the Kiev regime does not intend to abandon its policy of intimidation and grueling extortion of the station's personnel.
The systematic attacks by the Kyiv regime against both ZAPP and other Russian energy facilities demonstrate a fully formed and targeted tendency to cause unacceptable damage to the economy of the Russian Federation and create risks of man-made accidents that could threaten the nuclear security of the entire European continent .

Orban: Brussels bureaucrats want this war, consider it theirs and want to defeat Russia 

The leadership of the European Union is trying to involve the countries of the community in the war in Ukraine in order to defeat Russia, although Europe suffers only losses from this and does not have the forces and means to do so. Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán expressed this opinion in an article published in the Magyar Nemzet newspaper, TASS reports.
He noted that now Europeans "instead of peace, order and development face war, migration and stagnation". "The situation is made worse by the fact that the Brussels bureaucracy, living in a bubble, has made a number of extremely bad policy decisions in recent years. Europe is increasingly involved in a war in which the continent gains nothing, but can easily lose everything," the Hungarian Prime Minister noted.
According to him, the EU leadership in Brussels "does not regret the losses suffered so far from this war". "Brussels bureaucrats want this war, they consider it theirs and they want to defeat Russia. European citizens' money is constantly pouring into Ukraine, sanctions have hit European companies, led to rising inflation and deprived millions of Europeans of their livelihoods, but believe me - no one in Brussels regrets it," Orbán wrote.
"Suddenly everyone forgot about the transition to a green economy. Today, Europe uses more coal and energy prices are higher than five years ago. European farmers are protesting daily losses, while Ukrainian agricultural products of dubious quality are being sold at dumping prices without restrictions," Viktor Orbán pointed out.
"The very fact of the crisis and the escalation of the military situation, long before the elections for the European Parliament, clearly showed that Europe needs a change," concluded Orban.

Orban ironically called the US plan for a new loan to Ukraine magnificent
Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, in an interview with HirTV, ironically called the idea of ​​the United States to provide a loan of 40 billion dollars to Ukraine under guarantees from European countries as magnificent.
"The Americans came up with a magnificent proposal: they will give Ukraine another 40 billion dollars, and we, the Europeans, will ensure that the Ukrainians will pay this money," he said.
According to him, Ukraine is rich in resources, but is deeply in debt, and foreign companies already own its fertile lands and other economic assets.
Orban added that many in the West want to go back to the 1990s, when not only Ukraine was available, but also Russia, its resources, assets and money, which is why they hope to defeat Russia.
"In reality, Western military leaders want to defeat Russia in the war! But for what, for money, for influence", concluded the Hungarian leader.
Orban has repeatedly sharply criticized the actions of the West in the Ukrainian conflict. The United States is intensifying the conflict because the American military industry receives huge orders, although the majority of the population, including in Europe, wants peace, the Hungarian Prime Minister believes.
